Title: Data Analyst
Description:
payabl. empowers businesses to grow through payments innovation and banking services. Our ambition is to expand our strong portfolio of global financial services we provide to business and make them all available in one place on our platform we call payabl.one.

As a licensed financial company with principal membership with card schemes, we specialize in global payments and providing businesses with multi-currency accounts. With offices located in Frankfurt, Amsterdam, Limassol, and London, we are currently undergoing significant expansion and are looking for a Data Analyst to join our team. This role can be in one of our offices in Frankfurt, Limassol, Amsterdam, or London, it can also be remote anywhere in Europe.

This role is about:

The Data Analyst role is responsible for collecting, processing data of business information systems to discover useful information, suggest conclusions, and support decision-making. Furthermore you will identify challenges and opportunities within the organization and provide solutions that help achieve the business' goals. Strong technology, analytical and communication skills are must-have traits. You will be a driving force in data systems development, backing up suggestions with evidence.

You will:


Analyse data, outlining challenges, opportunities and solutions based on the internal and external data
Filtering the data, handling missing values, and preparing the dataset for analysis to ensure accuracy and relevance
Use statistical tools and techniques to explore and analyze data, identifying patterns, relationships, and trends
Create visual representations of data findings through charts, graphs, and dashboards to make the data understandable at a glance
Prepare reports and presentations to communicate the insights and findings from the data to stakeholders, which can influence policy and decision-making processes
Work with other departments to understand their data needs and help them make informed decisions based on data insights



What we need:


Excellent communication and interpersonal skills
Excellent at presenting data analysis insights to any type of audience in a clear and actionable way
Have a sense of ownership and assume end-to-end responsibility in everything you do
Experience working with senior decision makers
Conduct data analysis with Python (Pandas, Matplotlib, SciPy), SQL, Excel
Experience with data visualization tools (Power BI, Tableau or Qlik) and databases (PostgreSQL, BigQuery, Apache Druid)
Ability to automate data reports, ensuring efficiency and accuracy in data delivery
Familiarity with tools and software that enable scheduling and automatic generation of reports (e.g., cron jobs, Apache Airflow, Microsoft Power Automate)
Experience with Event Tracking, conceptualizing product events, and product analytics tools (Amplitude, Google Analytics, Matomo, etc.)



The perks of being a payabler:


üöó Drive in Style: After your probation, a sleek company car is all yours.
Future-Proof Your Finances: Jump on board, and after your probation period, we'll kickstart your Provident Fund
üå± Grow Without Limits: Our environment is all about nurturing your talents and fueling your ambition with endless opportunities for professional development.
Speak Like a Local: Greek language classes, offered twice a week for all team members.
üí≥ Shop and Save: Get exclusive access to a discount card at various local businesses.
üåçThrive in a multicultural workplace that celebrates diversity and values your unique contributions. Here, every perspective is appreciated, and every voice is heard.
Lead the Charge in Pioneering Projects: Be at the forefront of innovation by playing a key role in groundbreaking projects.
üèù Max Out Your Downtime: With 25 days off plus public holidays, and an extra 10 days for when you're under the weather, we make sure you have ample time to relax, recharge, and return brighter.
üìö Support for Your Educational Aspirations: We're here to support your educational pursuits because we believe in investing in your growth.
üçî Wolt Your Way Through Lunch: Enjoy a Wolt lunch allowance of ‚Ç¨150 per month


Ready to Join Us?

Let's embark on a journey to redefine the landscape of payments together. We're not just offering a role; we're inviting you to be a part of something bigger. Join our team, and let's innovate, disrupt, and lead the future of payments. Together, we can make an impact that resonates. Welcome to the team!

If this role seems like a good match, please submit your resume all applications are treated with the strictest confidentiality. Please note that we may keep your CV for a period of one (1) year for future relevant job opportunities. For more information about how we process your data please see our privacy policy at https://www.payabl.com/privacy-policy

Title: Data Insights and Optimization Analyst Intern
Description:
Company Description

Would you like to join an internship at a Coffee & Tea company that

values your future success and prioritizes your passion for positive change?

Check out this internship starting September 2024 and Unleash Your Possibility at JDE Peet's!




Company Details

At JDE Peet's (before: JACOBS DOUWE EGBERTS), we're not just about Coffee or Tea; we're all about the moments and connections they spark. With a history spanning 270 years, we've been shaping the daily rituals of people worldwide, driven by our dedication to quality products and sustainability.




We are action-driven and deliver our commitments. This means the freedom to challenge the status quo and to look for different perspectives. Our teams work by four fundamental values: We are progressive in outlook, ambitious in nature, resourceful in action and decisive in approach. These values paint the best picture of the kind of fast-moving culture you'll join at JDE Peet's.




Job Description

Join us as Data Insights and Optimization Analyst Intern at our international headquarters in Utrecht, starting in September 2024. In this internship, you'll delve into our organization's dynamic Ecosystem to extract valuable insights. You will learn how to identify and emphasize high-impact data attributes, contributing to informed business decision-making.




Your Key Activities Will Be

Conduct a comprehensive inventory of data within our Ecosystem
Analyze the usage patterns of different data attributes, identifying high-impact data fields and underutilized areas, and providing recommendations for strategic enhancements.
Quantify the volume and significance of data points associated with each field, offering a comprehensive view of our data landscape
Analyze the relation of data usage with the user profile (optional)
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather additional insights and context about data usage and dependencies
Document findings in clear and concise reports, presentations, and visualizations




Supported by a commendable 4.5 Glassdoor rating and 94% intern recommendation score, we pledge to provide you with a unique learning experience in our Data Management team. During your internship, you'll gain valuable insights into strategic data analysis and decision-making. You will collaborate with various teams, analyse different data points, and identify key areas for business improvement.




What's in it for you?

A monthly internship allowance of ‚Ç¨525 (full-time)
Travel compensation if you don't have a free public transport card
Paid holidays for each internship term
Two weeks of remote working anywhere in Europe (EEA)
The chance to learn from the best Data Management professionals out there!




Qualifications

Are you bursting with fresh ideas and a hunger for learning? We want you!




Here's What We're Looking For

Academic Program: You are enrolled in a BSc or MSc program for the entirety of the internship, preferably in Data Analytics, Business, or a related field.
Skillset: You possess strong MS Office skills and fluent proficiency in speaking and written English ‚Äì Having some similar hands-on experience with food research activities is always a benefit.
Personal traits: You have a structured approach, a driven and energetic personality, excellent communication and people skills, and the ability to work both in a team and independently.
Commitment: You are ready to dedicate at least 5 months to this internship, preferably from the 2nd of September to January.
Availability: You can join the internship for 3 - 4 days per week, including three days in-office and one or two days remotely, ensuring an ideal balance between collaboration and independence.




As we hope to have piqued your interest, please ensure you also meet the eligibility criteria and academic requirements:

Your internship should be included in your study curriculum and directly contribute to your academic results.
Your educational institution is willing to sign a collaboration agreement with JDE Peet's and when joining our Research departments, also sign an NDA agreement for internships.
You are either an EU(EEA) student residing in the Netherlands during the internship or a Non-EU(EEA) student enrolled and living in the Netherlands during the internship.




Additional Information

Are you ready to Unleash Your Possibility within JDE Peet's?




Here's How To Apply

Upload your resume (in English) using our LinkedIn or career site application form.
After applying, we'll reach out within three weeks to let you know what's next.
During the application process, you'll be asked to do an online assessment and at least one interview at our Utrecht office.




If you have questions, don't hesitate to contact our Campus team at IHQinternships@jdecoffee.com -- We're here to help!

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Data-analist




Ready to break boundaries in the analytical world? Accelerate your further Analytics engineering career with our advanced training program while working for our partner organization. We fully pay this program as well as your salary.




‚úÖ Help a data driven team and their business by developing data-driven business solutions

‚úÖ Working on the data modelling and creating relevant data sets and dashboard

‚úÖ Build data pipelines to facilitate reporting

‚úÖ Improving and automating data flows and processes




The role itself

¬∑ 2 fulltime weeks of hands-on bootcamp training where you‚Äôll focus on writing deployable code, containerization, Analytics engineering & data engineering fundamentals

¬∑ Work 4 days a week as an Analytics engineer at one of our clients

¬∑ Join us every Wednesday at the Xccelerated office in Amsterdam. Here you will get ongoing training and project support from our technical leads

¬∑ At the end of your first year, you get the opportunity to join the partner organization directly




As an Analytics engineer you will work together with Data engineer & BI developers, whereby you will contribute on developing data-driven business solutions. You will do this in the form of machine learning models, strategic analyses and a self-service data model.

A big focus of your role will be data modelling and creating relevant data sets and dashboards. You will also be the one that transforms raw data to structured data files. To achieve this, you will build data pipelines to fully automate the availability of data for reporting.




About Xccelerated

Xccelerated is an initiative within the Xebia Group, accelerating growth of Data, Cloud & AI competence. Our 13-month advanced training programs integrate hands-on learning and skill development with working at one of our partner companies. It is an intense learning journey for who have proven their potential and are ready for the next step in their career.

Are you one of them? Join our dream team of 45 great people. Each member of our team brings a unique specialty and passion to our shared mission: eliminate the shortage of highly skilled Data & AI professionals. To achieve our goal, we empower each other to reach their full potential and inspire others to do the same.




This is you

From a personal perspective, you are customer focused and have a strong can-do mentality.

We are looking for a communicatively strong and enthusiastic colleague with a passion for data. Next to this, you have:

‚úÖ A bachelor‚Äôs or master‚Äôs degree

‚úÖ 1-4 years of work experience as an Analytics engineer/BI Developer/Data analyst

‚úÖ Experience with data modelling, dashboarding and visualization (PowerBI)

‚úÖ Experience with SQL; preferably also Python

‚úÖ Experience with Cloud components




What Xccelerated offers




üí∞ Good salary

üõ´ 25 vacation days

üìô Kick off with 2 full-time weeks of hands-on bootcamp training

üìä Technical trainings & Innovation days for a full year (every week)

‚úÖ Challenging assignments

üíª Macbook and Iphone

üçé Lunches, amazing coffee and snack bar

üéíFlexibility in working from home & at the office

Interested? We‚Äôd love to meet you!




Please get in touch! Contact Jessie Loogman at jloogman@xccelerated.io or by phone at +31650999663.




Application Process

¬∑ First interview with one of our recruitment consultants

¬∑ Making a technical assessment (from home) you will present to one of or Tech Leads (home/on remote)

**We aim to complete an application process (from application to offer) within 1-3 weeks. As you will understand, this also depends on your own availability.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
ü™ê Discover our galaxy

Malt is Europe's leading freelancing platform with one clear mission: to give people the freedom to choose who they work with. Co-founded in 2013 by Vincent Huguet, with Alexandre Fretti as co-CEO since 2022, Malt is a tech company with a human approach that helps companies and freelancers make the perfect match.

Malt is a marketplace that embraces a community of over 700,000 freelancers and over 70,000 clients, ranging from small and medium-sized enterprises to large corporations. More than just a connector, our marketplace streamlines freelancer-client communications, simplifies administrative and legal tasks, expedites invoicing and payments, and so much more.

We are all about giving both freelancers and companies choice and added peace of mind, so that every experience on Malt is nothing less than (inter)stellar. The launch of Malt Strategy in 2023 enabled Malt to broaden its scope by offering the expertise of a network of top independent consultants and transition managers, to better support companies from the strategy to the implementation of ambitious projects.

‚ú® Malt is also‚Ä¶


a tech company with a human approach
a company with a strong culture fueled by 700 Malters from 40+ nationalities, working from 9 countries all around Europe - Germany, Belgium, United Arab Emirates, Spain, France, Netherlands, Nordic countries, United Kingdom, and Switzerland
committed to creating a safe and inclusive space where every employee can thrive both personally and professionally
committed to equality and diversity (50% of People managers are women)
a company with strong career path policies allowing all Malters to develop and grow equally
backed by renowned investors including ISAI, Serena, Eurazeo Growth, Goldman Sachs and BPI France




Join us on Planet Malt, we need you to help us write this next chapter! ü™ê

At Malt we believe that Ambition is the Way, so all lists of missions and responsibilities are non-exhaustive.

Explore your future career üî≠

You would be part of Malt‚Äôs data team, an international team of about 30 people, with various profiles, including 7 data analysts, analytics engineers, data engineers, data scientists, and economists... The team is led by Claire Lebarz, Chief Data & AI Officer @ Malt, and former Head of Data @ Airbnb.

Join us and become part of the #FutureOfwork!

Key Responsibilities ‚ú®


Develop a deep understanding of our freelancers and clients and how they interact with each other and with our product
Be a partner to product and business teams across the marketplace, helping them to better understand their performance through strategic analytics and structured thinking
Support our most strategic topics with deep-dive analytics, insights, recommendations
Empower the teams across Malt to answer data questions quickly and easily by building high-quality ground truth data sets, metrics and dashboards.
Contribute to the modelization of our databases and semantic layer along with analytics engineers
Be a key member of the data team, helping spread the data and AI culture within Malt




About You üßë‚ÄçüöÄ


You have a Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science, Operations Research) or in Business
You have +5 years of experience as a data analyst in a fast-paced and quantitative environment (start-up, scale-up, consulting‚Ä¶)
You consider yourself a full-stack data analyst: You write SQL perfectly, you know how to work with ETLs, you‚Äôve been using data modelization tools such as dbt, you can write simple Python scripts‚Ä¶ You are also very comfortable in using data visualization tools (e.g. Looker, Metabase, Tableau‚Ä¶)
You have strong communication (written and oral), presentation-building and storytelling skills
You are fluent in English
You are curious and eager to learn new things and grow




What makes you different from others? ü´µ


You have good business acumen, but you also have a ‚Äúhacker‚Äù mindset, you enjoy leveraging technology to find solutions to problems
You have a growth mindset: you are comfortable in navigating and excelling in fast-paced environments with no playbook for success
You have an ability to influence people, but you are also a strong team player




How to join the mission? üöÄ


Screening with Alex, our Tech Talent Acquisition Manager, to better understand your background, aspirations and answer your questions (45 minutes)
Take home technical assessment with the Data Director (Gautier Chenard), one Data Analyst and another member of the data team (60mn)
Past Presentation project and restitution to the Data Director, one member of Ops team and one Product Manager (1h)
Interview with Claire, our Chief Data Officer (30mn)




Malt is the perfect space to thrive personally and professionally üí´


Onboarding: Before easing into your new role, you‚Äôll spend your first week learning about our culture, products, and services with other onboardees at our office in Paris
Equity: Every Malter is entitled to stock options
Lunch vouchers (legal benefit): ‚Ç¨9/day on your Swile card
Transportation (legal benefit): 50% reimbursement (any type of transport)
Healthcare insurance (legal benefit)
RTT: From 8 to 12 days off per year
Sports: Company participation to a Gymlib membership
Malt sabbatical: Every three years, all Malters are entitled to a one month fully paid sabbatical leave
Free books: If you‚Äôre interested in learning more about any topic relevant to Malt‚Äôs business, just tell us the books you‚Äôd like to read, and we‚Äôll order them for you‚Äîwithout any questions asked or approval processes to follow
Remote work: Hybrid policy balancing on-site and home office
Team building events organized every year




Ready? Get your ticket to Malt ü™ê

  • Develop a deep understanding of our freelancers and clients and how they interact with each other and with our product
  • Be a partner to product and business teams across the marketplace, helping them to better understand their performance through strategic analytics and structured thinking
  • Support our most strategic topics with deep-dive analytics, insights, recommendations
  • Empower the teams across Malt to answer data questions quickly and easily by building high-quality ground truth data sets, metrics and dashboards.
  • Contribute to the modelization of our databases and semantic layer along with analytics engineers
  • Be a key member of the data team, helping spread the data and AI culture within Malt



About You üßë‚ÄçüöÄ

  • You have a Master‚Äôs degree in a quantitative field (e.g., Statistics, Econometrics, Computer Science, Engineering, Mathematics, Data Science, Operations Research) or in Business
  • You have +5 years of experience as a data analyst in a fast-paced and quantitative environment (start-up, scale-up, consulting‚Ä¶)
  • You consider yourself a full-stack data analyst: You write SQL perfectly, you know how to work with ETLs, you‚Äôve been using data modelization tools such as dbt, you can write simple Python scripts‚Ä¶ You are also very comfortable in using data visualization tools (e.g. Looker, Metabase, Tableau‚Ä¶)
  • You have strong communication (written and oral), presentation-building and storytelling skills
  • You are fluent in English
  • You are curious and eager to learn new things and grow



What makes you different from others? ü´µ

  • You have good business acumen, but you also have a ‚Äúhacker‚Äù mindset, you enjoy leveraging technology to find solutions to problems
  • You have a growth mindset: you are comfortable in navigating and excelling in fast-paced environments with no playbook for success
  • You have an ability to influence people, but you are also a strong team player



How to join the mission? üöÄ

  • Screening with Alex, our Tech Talent Acquisition Manager, to better understand your background, aspirations and answer your questions (45 minutes)
  • Take home technical assessment with the Data Director (Gautier Chenard), one Data Analyst and another member of the data team (60mn)
  • Past Presentation project and restitution to the Data Director, one member of Ops team and one Product Manager (1h)
  • Interview with Claire, our Chief Data Officer (30mn)



Malt is the perfect space to thrive personally and professionally üí´

  • Onboarding: Before easing into your new role, you‚Äôll spend your first week learning about our culture, products, and services with other onboardees at our office in Paris
  • Equity: Every Malter is entitled to stock options
  • Lunch vouchers (legal benefit): ‚Ç¨9/day on your Swile card
  • Transportation (legal benefit): 50% reimbursement (any type of transport)
  • Healthcare insurance (legal benefit)
  • RTT: From 8 to 12 days off per year
  • Sports: Company participation to a Gymlib membership
  • Malt sabbatical: Every three years, all Malters are entitled to a one month fully paid sabbatical leave
  • Free books: If you‚Äôre interested in learning more about any topic relevant to Malt‚Äôs business, just tell us the books you‚Äôd like to read, and we‚Äôll order them for you‚Äîwithout any questions asked or approval processes to follow
  • Remote work: Hybrid policy balancing on-site and home office
  • Team building events organized every year



Ready? Get your ticket to Malt ü™ê

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At S[&]T we contribute to a safer life on Earth by translating space data into valuable and actionable insights. With this, we help organizations, governments and commercial entities to strengthen their information position and thereby improve their decision-making. We focus on 4 domains: Space & Science, Defence & Security, Environment & Sustainability and the High-Tech Industry. We control all levels of the data value chain from data source to user applications, and apply our expertise within our innovations, customer projects and talent acquisition services. Our headquarters are in Delft, The Netherlands and we have two satellite offices in Oslo, Norway, and Rome, Italy with a total of 125 experts employed at S[&]T.




We are currently looking for a Data Analyst to join the team in Delft.




As a Data Analyst, you analyze and interpret raw spectra data and convert it into useful information.




Responsibilities:

You will collect, check, and structure data.
You will design data processing algorithms that process obtained spectra into accurate material properties, such as elemental mass percentages.
You will create data models.
You will draw up reports and presentations.
You will provide advice on the information obtained, such as material sampling strategy, measurement strategy, or measurement setup improvements.
You will participate in project teams.




Requirements:

You have a Master‚Äôs Degree in Mathematics, Physics, or Computer Science.
You have experience in collecting, processing, and analysing data, preferably in a high-tech environment.
You have strong communication skills.
You have a broad knowledge of Python, programming languages, and analysis methods, such as statistical analysis, least-squares regression and curve-fitting, and machine learning.
You have the ability to explain complex information in an understandable way.
You have theoretical and practical knowledge of data modelling and semantics.




Interested? Then click to apply or send your CV and motivational letter to recruitment@stcorp.nl.




Privacy Notice: In order to apply for this vacancy you must submit your personal information to Science [&] Technology. Science [&] Technology will collect, use, and process your personal information as mentioned in our Privacy Policy. Our policy and processing of your personal information are compliant with the GDPR.




Please note that if you do not hear back from us within 10 days of your application, you may assume that we have selected another candidate we would like to interview for this position. We do our best to get back to you individually, however, due to a high volume of responses, we might not have been able to reject your application in person.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Overview:

Under Schneider Electric‚Äôs Energy Management Business, Ecommerce & Distribution is a ~20.0B‚Ç¨ revenue channel addressing our customers, mostly through distributors. To support Ecommerce & Distribution growth in China and IO, a dedicated Analytics organization was set in 2021. Its objective is to build and Scale Analytics Capabilities to deliver the best End-to-End buying experience for customers.

We are seeking a highly skilled Data Analyst who can bridge the gap between business needs and technical solutions. The ideal candidate will have a strong analytical mindset, excellent communication skills, and the ability to translate business requirements into actionable insights and specifications for developers.

Responsibilities:


Business Requirement Analysis:
Collaborate with business stakeholders to gather, understand, and document detailed business requirements.
Conduct in-depth analysis to identify key business problems and opportunities.
Data Analysis:
Extract, clean, and analyze large datasets to generate insights that support business objectives.
Utilize statistical methods and tools to identify trends, patterns, and anomalies.
Translation of Requirements:
Translate business requirements into technical specifications for developers.
Develop clear and detailed documentation including data models, workflows, and process diagrams.
Collaboration:
Work closely with developers to ensure technical solutions align with business needs.
Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams to ensure seamless communication and project delivery.
Reporting and Visualization:
Create and maintain reports, dashboards, and visualizations to communicate insights effectively to both technical and non-technical audiences.
Present findings and recommendations to stakeholders in a clear and concise manner.
Quality Assurance:
Validate data integrity and accuracy of reports and analytical models.
Perform data quality checks and troubleshoot any discrepancies.
Continuous Improvement:
Identify areas for process improvement and propose solutions to enhance data analysis and reporting capabilities.

Stay updated with the latest industry trends and best practices in data analysis and business intelligence


Education:
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business, Statistics, or a related field. Master‚Äôs degree preferred.
Experience:
Proven experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar role, with a strong emphasis on translating business requirements into technical specifications.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and languages such as SQL, Python, R, and Excel.
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Skills:
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
Ability to work effectively in a team-oriented environment.
Detail-oriented with a strong focus on data accuracy and quality.
Familiarity with software development processes and methodologies.
Certifications:
Relevant certifications in data analysis, business analysis, or related areas are a plus.

Working Conditions:


This position may require occasional travel to meet with business stakeholders and technical teams.
Flexible working hours may be required to accommodate project deadlines and collaboration across time zones.


Let us learn about you! Apply today.

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.

Looking to make an IMPACT with your career?

When you are thinking about joining a new team, culture matters. At Schneider Electric, our values and behaviors are the foundation for creating a great culture to support business success. We believe that our IMPACT values - Inclusion, Mastery, Purpose, Action, Curiosity, Teamwork - starts with us.

IMPACT is also your invitation to join Schneider Electric where you can contribute to turning sustainability ambition into actions, no matter what role you play. It is a call to connect your career with the ambition of achieving a more resilient, efficient, and sustainable world.

We are looking for IMPACT Makers; exceptional people who turn sustainability ambitions into actions at the intersection of automation, electrification, and digitization. We celebrate IMPACT Makers and believe everyone has the potential to be one.

Become an IMPACT Maker with Schneider Electric - apply today!

‚Ç¨36 billion global revenue

+13% organic growth

150 000+ employees in 100+ countries

#1 on the Global 100 World‚Äôs most sustainable corporations

You must submit an online application to be considered for any position with us. This position will be posted until filled.

Schneider Electric aspires to be the most inclusive and caring company in the world, by providing equitable opportunities to everyone, everywhere, and ensuring all employees feel uniquely valued and safe to contribute their best. We mirror the diversity of the communities in which we operate, and ‚Äòinclusion‚Äô is one of our core values. We believe our differences make us stronger as a company and as individuals and we are committed to championing inclusivity in everything we do. This extends to our Candidates and is embedded in our Hiring Practices.

You can find out more about our commitment to Diversity, Equity and Inclusion here and our DEI Policy here

At Schneider Electric, we uphold the highest standards of ethics and compliance, and we believe that trust is a foundational value. Our Trust Charter is our Code of Conduct and demonstrates our commitment to ethics, safety, sustainability, quality and cybersecurity, underpinning every aspect of our business and our willingness to behave and respond respectfully and in good faith to all our stakeholders. Title: BI-Analyst
Description:
We are seeking a BI and data visualization specialist who is passionate about data, enjoys creating visualizations, and can't go a day without developing an awesome dashboard or data mart.




We need someone who is ready to take responsibility for a pool of dashboards for the finance department ‚Äî developing a roadmap for data marts and dashboards, creating new dashboards and data marts, improving existing ones, and finding ways to enhance our business processes. Our tech stack includes Oracle NetSuite as the primary source, a variety of SaaS services as auxiliary sources, Oracle and PostgreSQL databases, and Tableau. This role involves collaborating directly with stakeholders and managing small projects.




What You Will Do:




Develop user-friendly and valuable management dashboards as part of the finance team.
Manage the pool of dashboards as a product: gather requirements, maintain a backlog of enhancements and ideas, and keep your dashboards and data organized.
Create simple ETL pipelines and manage SQL code.
Assist employees in self-service and improve their data literacy skills.




We Expect You:




Enjoy data visualization and finding the best ways to present data for business decision-making.
Have experience with Tableau, understand the tool's strengths and limitations, or have worked with other BI systems and are willing to master Tableau quickly.
Be proficient in SQL and capable of preparing data sources for dashboards.
Know when to use Python instead of SQL and have basic knowledge of the language.
Be able to communicate with stakeholders and gather task requirements.
Have the ability to double-check your work before publishing in a production environment.




It's a Plus If You:




Are passionate about data visualization or interface design, and enjoy books by Tufte, Few, or Norman.
Have a portfolio on Tableau Public
Have extensive experience with Oracle Analytical Warehouse or dbt.
Can work without detailed specifications or know how to collect them for dashboards used by a large number of users without a single client.
Have knowledge of RPA automation.
Show more

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Red Carpet IT Services is voor een opdrachtgever op zoek naar een Data Analyst . Mocht dit een passende functie voor je zijn, dan horen we het graag!




Functie-informatie:

Je vertaalt business-doelen naar datavereisten en -toepassingen/inzichten en werkt daarbij nauw samen met zowel technische en business expertises. Je weet waar de gebruikte data vandaan komt en waar het voor gebruikt wordt en maakt daarover waar nodig afspraken met producenten en afnemers. Je hebt ervaring op het gebied van requirements, data-analyse, impact analyse, datamodellering, rapportage ontwikkeling en vind het leuk om data gedreven experimenten aan te gaan.




Functie-eisen:

Je bent naast een teamspeler ook sterk in het schrijven van queries in SQL of je hebt ervaring met een andere programmeertaal. Je bent goed in werken met Tableau en hebt frisse idee√´n waar het gaat om data visualisatie. Deze idee√´n kan je presenteren aan je directe collega`s en stakeholders, maar je laat ze ook realiteit worden.

Verder heb je:

Hbo/WO werk- en denkniveau
Minimaal 1-3 jaar relevante werkervaring in Data Management
Kennis en ervaring op het gebied van agile werken is een pr√©

Deze idee√´n kan je presenteren aan je directe collega`s en stakeholders, maar je laat ze ook realiteit worden.

Verder heb je:

  • Hbo/WO werk- en denkniveau
  • Minimaal 1-3 jaar relevante werkervaring in Data Management
  • Kennis en ervaring op het gebied van agile werken is een pr√©

Title: Senior Data Analyst - GTM (Remote Europe)
Description:
n8n is a low-code platform for workflow automation and AI app integration, designed for technical users. It simplifies connecting to any app or API and enables the incorporation of AI into business processes. n8n is Source Code Available and has a passionate and engaged community of builders!

We were founded end of 2019 and currently:

üßë‚Äçü§ù‚Äçüßë We're a diverse team of 60 talented people

üöÄ Our annual recurring revenue is growing 5x year-over-year

‚≠êÔ∏è With +44k GitHub stars, we are in the top 0.0001% most popular projects on Github

üå± We now count a total of $20m in funding: we were Sequoia's first seed investment in Germany, and most recently secured a Series A extension (February 2024)

MISSIONS

üéØ Your main goal will be to unlock insights that drive revenue growth and optimize sales & marketing efficiency at n8n.

To achieve this, you will:

1- Empower Marketing with actionable data insights

üîç Transform complex marketing data into accessible insights by optimizing our BigQuery setup and integrating with tools like Metabase

üìä Analyze campaign performance, demographic trends, and product telemetry to help the marketing team focus on high-impact areas

üîó Centralize and link additional data sources such as HockeyStack, Reo.dev, and Scarf to deepen our understanding of user behavior

2- Support RevOps and Sales with strategic analytics

üìà Build and maintain dashboards that provide real-time visibility into sales performance and marketing ROI

üõ†Ô∏è Run ad-hoc analyses to support sales strategies and inform RevOps decision-making

üß© Develop attribution models to map out customer journeys and identify key conversion points

3- Optimize SEO and content strategies with data science

üîó Leverage data science techniques to analyze node usage, SEO performance, and keyword strategies for maximum impact

üß† Provide actionable recommendations to enhance our online presence and content marketing efforts

üöÄ Explore new avenues for personalizing SEO strategies based on user interaction data

4- Proactively identify opportunities for growth

üå± Continuously explore new data sources and methodologies to unlock further growth opportunities

üß© Collaborate closely with cross-functional teams to ensure data-driven decision-making across the organization

üí° Be a proactive voice at the table, driving conversations on how data can further our ambitious goals

5- Drive data-driven decision making across GTM

üéØ Lead efforts to ensure data-driven decision-making becomes a core part of our GTM culture, empowering team members with the insights they need.

üìö Maintain and expand our GTM data documentation, ensuring consistency and accessibility for current and future team members.

üõ†Ô∏è Set up and manage the necessary tools, systems, and processes that streamline data access and analysis for GTM teams.

Requirements

Must-have

üõ†Ô∏è 5+ years of relevant experience: You have a proven track record in data analytics, data science, or business intelligence, particularly in a marketing context.

üíª Advanced SQL proficiency: You are skilled in complex queries, including aggregations, joins, and filters, and can make data accessible to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.

üåê Expertise with Google Analytics, Tag Manager, and BigQuery: You can handle data sources, manage transformations, and deliver actionable insights from complex datasets.

üìä Experience with revenue/sales CRM systems (especially Salesforce): You understand how to integrate CRM data with marketing analytics to drive sales and revenue growth.

üéØ Focus on business impact: You have a strong ability to translate data into strategic recommendations that directly contribute to revenue growth and operational efficiency.

‚öôÔ∏è Pragmatic problem-solving skills: You are known for your bias for action and your ability to tackle complex challenges with practical solutions.

üîç Proactive and curious mindset: You continuously seek out opportunities for analysis, always asking 'why' to uncover deeper insights.

üìà Experience in early-stage data teams: You've successfully set up tools, systems, and processes in a fast-paced, growing environment.

Nice-to-have

üîó SEO and content marketing experience: You've worked with SEO datasets/tools and have a solid understanding of how to integrate these insights into broader marketing strategies.

üìä Data science/BI experience: You bring additional expertise in data science methodologies or business intelligence platforms, enhancing your ability to deliver sophisticated analyses.

n8n is an equal opportunity employer and does not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, colour, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status.

We can sponsor visas to Germany; for any other country, you need to have existing right to work.


Our company language is English


You care about diversity and inclusion? We do too! Check out our Diversity, Inclusion and Belonging initiatives at n8n.*

Benefits

üí∏ Competitive compensation

üí™ Ownership: Our core value is to "empower others", and we give you a slice of n8n in the form of equity.

üèñÔ∏è Work/life balance: We work hard, but make sure everyone can properly recharge their batteries with 30 days holiday, plus public holidays wherever you are.

üìà Career growth: We are looking to hire 'rising stars', who can grow with the company into more senior roles. We give you ‚Ç¨1k a year to spend on courses, books, events and coaching, to support you in developing your career.

ü§© A passionate team: We love our product, and we have regular office hackathons to see who can build the coolest thing with it!

üåè Remote-first: Our team works remote from anywhere within Europe but we have regular off-sites to help build team bonds and alignment.

üôè Transparency: We all know what everyone's working on, how's the company doing ‚Äî the whole shebang.

ü§ù Giving back: We're big fans of open source, and you'll get $100 per month to support projects you care about.

üòç Ambitious but kind culture where people love to work - our eNPS for 2023 is 100!

Disclaimer: If you see the same job posting in different locations, it's because we're hiring remotely and are pushing it to several locations! We're currently only making one RevOps hire. Please do not apply twice for the same position.

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Are you our new colleague?

We‚Äôre looking for a Senior Data Analyst at Diemen HQ, Netherlands. Hybrid. Fulltime.




people at the heart of everything we do

Working at Randstad is unlike working at any organization. Because at Randstad we put people at the heart of everything we do. This goes for our clients, our talent, our employees, and society. We combine our passion for people with the power of today‚Äôs technologies. This helps us support people and organizations in realizing their true potential. Learn more about our mission, history and values on our website: www.randstad.com




how you will contribute

As a Senior Data Analyst at Randstad, you will leverage your excellent analytical skills and keen eye for detail to drive impactful data insights. In this role, you will go beyond the numbers to be the voice of data, effectively communicating with decision-makers, product owners, and team leaders.

You will thrive in our fast-paced corporate environment, adapting quickly to new challenges and finding pragmatic solutions. You will take ownership of your work, ensuring accuracy and consistency in all your analyses. Your ability to translate complex data into actionable insights will play a crucial role in guiding strategic decisions and driving the success of our initiatives.




what you will be doing

Within this role, via Randstad Market Insights (RMI), you will enable colleagues to make data driven decisions and conclusions by making data accessible and understandable. Behind the scenes you will set up and execute data analysis on a variety of internal and external data sources as well as build dashboards to generate actionable insights, keep track of the key data quality metrics and identify opportunities for improvement.




who will you work with

As part of the RMI team, you will collaborate closely with data engineers, data scientists, a product owner, a scrum master, and junior data analysts based in the Global Competency Center (GCC). Additionally, you will work alongside a senior data engineer, ensuring seamless integration and analysis of data across various projects.

In this guiding role, you will mentor and support junior data analysts, fostering their growth and development within the team. Your responsibilities will involve working with internal stakeholders to understand their data needs, translating these requirements into actionable insights, and ensuring the delivery of high-quality data solutions.




what you will bring

Your communication, visualization, and storytelling skills are well-developed, allowing you to effectively translate complex data into clear, compelling narratives for various audiences. With a track record in data analysis, preferably within a market intelligence or similar corporate environment, you excel in collaborative settings and are an excellent team player.

You possess fluency in data visualization and business intelligence (BI) tools enabling you to create insightful and impactful visual representations of data as well as proficiency in SQL. Additionally, you have hands-on experience with cloud platforms, particularly Google Cloud Platform (GCP), enhancing your ability to manage and analyze data in modern, scalable environments.

Your demonstrated ability to lead projects and mentor junior team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement within the team.




what‚Äôs in it for you

We put people at the heart of everything we do. Our employment conditions reflect this;

Hybrid work (based twice a week in Diemen HQ) with sporadic travel requirements
Competitive salary
An additional flexible benefit budget
Attractive bonus scheme
Option to take part in Randstad's success through our employee Share Purchase Plan
Option to go on a sabbatical leave or buy extra holidays
Attractive mobility arrangements
Opportunity to give back to local communities through paid volunteering leave
Growth and development opportunities in a fast changing global environment
Working with great people and being part of a network where everyone wants you to succeed
An environment where differences are understood, valued and celebrated




We want our teams and talent to reflect the rich diversity of the societies we serve. We thrive for an environment of belonging, safety and confidence. So everyone can bring their whole selves to work and flourish. Learn more about equity, diversity, inclusion and belonging at randstad here.




If you recognize yourself in the profile above, we invite you to apply for this role. For more information you can reach out to our Internal Talent Acquisition Partner Jenny Roberts (jennifer.roberts@randstadsourceright.co.uk)




The recruitment procedure consists of a screening, a 30 minute online behavioural assesment and at least two interviews.




We are an inclusive employer and should you require any reasonable adjustments in order to complete any aspect of the recruitment process, please contact the Internal Talent Acquisition (ITA) team

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Job Description

As a Data Analyst, you are part of the Data & BI team and will be responsible for transforming complex data into actionable insights by designing and developing interactive dashboards and reports. You make connections between data that is already present within different departments of our company (sales, HR, IT, installations). The main focus in this role will be to rebuild existing reports and consolidate them towards a single model. This will empower our organization to make informed decisions based on data-driven insights.

Your job


Reviewing report catalogs and data sources
Define a single model together with our Data Engineer
Rebuilding existing reports towards a single model
Identify process improvements, propose system modifications.
Audit data quality and define improvement plans.



We Offer

At Eneco eMobility, you come first. You are the driving force. We invest heavily in your personal and professional development ‚Äì because when you shine, we shine. Therefore, we offer our employees attractive conditions so you can stay energized while you keep your eyes on creating a better future.


Salary between ‚Ç¨3,882 - ‚Ç¨5,446 per month based on 40 hours.
An annual 5% development and vitality budget, including a sports allowance.
Access to Good Habitz development portal.
Hybrid working ‚Äì 2 days at home, 2 days in the office, and 1 day of your choice.
Home working allowance of ‚Ç¨32.50 per month.
OV free travel subscription (24/7 throughout the Netherlands). With your OV free card, you can also travel privately.
27 days of leave + option to purchase 5 extra days per year.
Working in the heart of Rotterdam, 3 minute walk from Rotterdam Central train station
Focus on adventure, balance, and fun.



Job requirements

Working at Eneco eMobility means working in an organization that seizes opportunities ‚Äì even if they are not readily available. What is certain now may be different tomorrow. You are given the space to experiment. That's why you clearly love adventure and like to put your hands on to the wheel to 'get the job done'. And although you can work independently, you also know that real impact is made together. In short:


3+ years of experience as BI Consultant / Data Analyst, or similar roles.
Experience with Power BI (or other reporting tooling)
Experience in rebuilding reports into a single model
Excellent communication skills
Knowledge of data governance principles, policies, and practice.
Experience with data visualization and UX
Bonus skill: Experience with data science (incl. programming)



Please apply with your resume and motivation letter explaining your experience, aligned with our requirements.
Show more

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
(Fulltime, 38hrs per week)

About The Job

Do you want to work for a highly successful, fast expanding international retailer with many growth opportunities? At Action we offer you the opportunity to become part of our newly created Strategy and Analytics team as Data Analyst and play an important role in supporting the overall growth of Action.

This is your daily action

The Data Analyst is part of the Business Development Team and reports to the Head of Business Development. Together with senior executives, the Strategy and Analytics team works on key topics for Action such as: Sustainability, Digitization, Expansion, Supply Chain and more. Together with your team members you support in driving data-driven decision-making across the organization.

Your work field is very dynamic, but in general involves tasks such as:


Build deep insights and analysis regarding the dynamic and competitive landscape in which we operate.
Work with our internal data and external market data to discover insights, converting these into tangible business recommendations that support our strategy.
Lead and participate in strategic projects, in close collaboration with your colleagues from the Strategy and Analytics Team and the Action team at large.
Support operational departments in root cause analyses and understanding performance issues


Your work location will be our International Head Office in Zwaagdijk (a 30 minutes traffic free drive from Amsterdam).

This is you

What you bring:


Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities.
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SQL, Python, R, and data visualization tools like Tableau, Power BI, or similar.
Familiarity with retail analytics, including sales forecasting, inventory, and customer behavior analysis.
Excellent communication and presentation skills.
Minimum of 2-3 years of experience in data analysis or a related field.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.


What we offer

Surprisingly much! From our international headquarters in the Netherlands you have an impact on what happens in our stores across Europe. We welcome more than 15 million customers every week in more than 2,600 stores in 12 European countries. We have great growth ambitions. For Action and for you. Because our growth means that you can always take new steps. A different position, an interesting innovation project, new skills: you can continue to develop as a professional. And all this in a culture where our shared values are truly lived: customer focus, teamwork, simplicity, discipline, cost conscious and respect

Did you know that you can also count on us for:


A competitive salary based on a 38-hour working week
24 paid vacation days with the option of purchasing 5 extra days (based on 38 hours per week).
A temporary contract with the intention of offering you a permanent contract in the long term
Flexible working hours
15% employee discount on your purchases at Action
A good pension scheme and collective health insurance


How we contribute to society

If you only know Action from the stores, a world will open up for you when you come and work with us. We work hard to make a positive impact on society and the environment. Did you know, for example, that we sponsor more than 2,500 children worldwide who grow up in an SOS Children's Village? That our team reflects the diversity of our customers, including 155 different nationalities? That we purchase 94% of our wood products and 100% of our cotton sustainably? And that almost all our stores only use energy-efficient LED lighting? Yes, that is also Action. Curious about what other initiatives we‚Äôre facilitating? Join our team and find out for yourself.

Interested?

Take action and apply now!

The next steps


Our recruiter will review your application and get back to you as soon as possible.
We invite you for a first job interview.
We would like to get to know you better, which is why we ask you to take an online assessment.
We will invite you for a second interview and we will discuss your assessment.
Are we still a great match? Then we will become new colleagues!


At Action, integrity is of great importance to us. A pre-employment screening is therefore part of the application process for this vacancy. Contact your recruiter for more information.
Show more

  • Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Mathematics, Economics, or a related field.

What we offer

Surprisingly much! From our international headquarters in the Netherlands you have an impact on what happens in our stores across Europe. We welcome more than 15 million customers every week in more than 2,600 stores in 12 European countries. We have great growth ambitions. For Action and for you. Because our growth means that you can always take new steps. A different position, an interesting innovation project, new skills: you can continue to develop as a professional. And all this in a culture where our shared values are truly lived: customer focus, teamwork, simplicity, discipline, cost conscious and respect

Did you know that you can also count on us for:

  • A competitive salary based on a 38-hour working week
  • 24 paid vacation days with the option of purchasing 5 extra days (based on 38 hours per week).
  • A temporary contract with the intention of offering you a permanent contract in the long term
  • Flexible working hours
  • 15% employee discount on your purchases at Action
  • A good pension scheme and collective health insurance

How we contribute to society

If you only know Action from the stores, a world will open up for you when you come and work with us. We work hard to make a positive impact on society and the environment. Did you know, for example, that we sponsor more than 2,500 children worldwide who grow up in an SOS Children's Village? That our team reflects the diversity of our customers, including 155 different nationalities? That we purchase 94% of our wood products and 100% of our cotton sustainably? And that almost all our stores only use energy-efficient LED lighting? Yes, that is also Action. Curious about what other initiatives we‚Äôre facilitating? Join our team and find out for yourself.

Interested?

Take action and apply now!

The next steps

  • Our recruiter will review your application and get back to you as soon as possible.
  • We invite you for a first job interview.
  • We would like to get to know you better, which is why we ask you to take an online assessment.
  • We will invite you for a second interview and we will discuss your assessment.
  • Are we still a great match? Then we will become new colleagues!

At Action, integrity is of great importance to us. A pre-employment screening is therefore part of the application process for this vacancy. Contact your recruiter for more information.

Title: Transportation Data Analyst (Citymapper)
Description:
At Citymapper (powered by Via), we‚Äôre on a mission to help make complex cities more accessible to everyday users. Our application transports millions of people in hundreds of cities around the world by giving them access to the most current and sophisticated transportation options available. We make getting around your favorite city easy, so that you can enjoy the ride.

As a Transportation Data Analyst (French-speaking) at Citymapper, you will be managing the data that is the backbone of our application‚Äôs success. Y our work directly impacts our user experience, and is the difference between a user seeing a bus drive away, or reaching it just in time. Millions of users around the world trust our application to be on time for work, a job interview, or a date - and we take great responsibility in fulfilling that need.

This job can be done remotely if you're based in England, the Netherlands, Germany or Bulgaria. If you prefer hybrid, we have offices in London, Berlin, Paris, Amsterdam, and Sofia.

What You'll Do:


You will help to manage the timetable data that powers the Citymapper application. Using proprietary tools and methods, you will transform often messy transit schedules into shiny and reliable user information.
You will build, validate and ship data to production on a daily basis.
You will manage data in a range of cities and across different formats.
You will work with our engineers to build for scale by improving tools and automating tasks.
You will ensure data quality in our web and mobile products so that users continue to love and trust Citymapper.


Who You Are:


Fluent French speaker (C1 and above)
You have a passion for public transportation and cities, and an interest in how public transportation networks operate.
You are comfortable dealing with large data sets, and have an eagerness to learn new data skills.
You take a hands-on, practical, pragmatic attitude to your work.
You have exceptional attention to detail, and an ability to communicate those details to other collaborators.
You have up to 3 years of experience working with data, Python and/or common transit data formats (GTFS, TransXChange, Siri, Hafas, etc).


What We Offer:


Becoming part of Via, a company that was awarded for its commitment to social good
Joining the team working on the industry-leading mobile app that is loved and trusted by millions of users
State of the art hardware for you to perform your work worry free
Ongoing support and training to ensure you have the resources you need to thrive and progress in your career
A hybrid or remote work model. Remote work is possible if you're based in one of these countries: England, Germany or Netherlands
Competitive compensation
Monthly health stipend
25 vacation days


We‚Äôre Via, and we build technology that changes the way the world moves. We pioneered the TransitTech category to ensure that the future of transportation is shared, dynamic public mobility ‚Äî the kind that reduces carbon emissions across congested cities, minimizes reliance on private cars, and provides everyone with accessible, efficient, and affordable ways of getting around.

We created the first end-to-end TransitTech solution for cities and transit agencies, offering world-class software, service design, and operational expertise to fundamentally improve the way the world moves.

Via was founded with the guiding principle that we go further when we go together. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace. If you‚Äôre excited about this role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every qualification in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyways. You may be just the right candidate for this or other roles. All backgrounds, identities, and voices are welcomed and celebrated at Via.

Ready to join the ride?

Via is an equal opportunity employer.

Title: Data Analyst, Commercial
Description:
Job Description

The position

We are looking for an energetic Commercial Data Analyst to join our Sales Operations Team at Sympower. As a fast growing company in a dynamic market, we are in need of a data enthusiast who is eager to make an impact by combining commercial and technical skills and influence the strategic decision-making process. Your ultimate goal is to provide insights and help make data-driven decisions to to take Sympower to the next level.

As part of the Commercial Team, you will work closely with our Marketing & Sales Team (and other Teams as required) to design, build and continuously develop our KPI framework within Commercial and Sympower as a whole.

What Is In It For You

We are committed to creating an inclusive and values based culture where everyone feels that they belong, and where everyone has the opportunity to do meaningful work.

We offer a market competitive compensation package, including but not limited to:


30 Days Paid Holiday Leave
1 Day Paid Wellness Leave
1 Day Paid Birthday Leave
Paid Maternity and Partner Leave
Pawternity Leave
Mental Health and Wellbeing Support
Remote Office Budget
Internet Allowance
Development Plan & Budget
Stock Appreciation Rights
2 Days Paid Volunteer Leave


Learn about all of our benefits on our careers page.

Job requirements

What You Will Do

As our Commercial Data Analyst, you‚Äôll be at the heart of Sympower‚Äôs growth, driving key insights that help shape our commerce strategy and operations. Your work will directly influence our move to the next level as you transform raw data into powerful tools for decision-making.

Here‚Äôs How You‚Äôll Make An Impact


Master the Data Landscape: Dive into our existing systems, datasets, and KPI metrics to understand the current landscape. Then, envision and chart your path forward by defining a strategic roadmap for 2025, working together with the team to achieve ambitious goals.
Create the Future: Imagine, design, and deliver cutting-edge KPI Dashboards that are not just informative but game-changing. Your mockups will set the standard for what‚Äôs possible, and your work will evolve from initial manual dashboards to a fully automated, self-service platform to enable continuous insights in our (daily) operations.
Own the Numbers: You‚Äôll be the go-to expert for all commercial data and KPI reporting. From day one, you‚Äôll take charge, ensuring consistency, accuracy, and reliability in all our reporting processes. You‚Äôll also be agile, adapting to new requests and updating processes as we grow.
Collaborate to Innovate: Work hand-in-hand with teams across Sympower, expanding your influence beyond the commercial realm. Together, you‚Äôll integrate data from various departments, building a company-wide KPI platform that drives performance across the board.
Lead with Data: Take on an advisory role where your insights will directly inform leadership decisions. Your data-driven recommendations will help steer Sympower‚Äôs strategic direction, making you a key player in our mission to accelerate the global transition to net-zero.


What You Will Need


Bachelor‚Äôs degree or similar level by experience
5+ years of working experience in a data focused role
Proven record of handling, owning, combining and analyzing relatively complex datasets
Experience in visualising data for various purposes/levels
Coding experience in Python/SQL is preferred
You are comfortable with switching between tasks and priorities and working with colleagues across the entire organization, including C-level positions
You do not shy away from taking an advisory role towards the Leadership Team (and other departments) based on the data you work with and analyze
Fluent in English, and other languages are nice to have


Who We Are

Sympower is accelerating the global transition towards ‚Äònet-zero‚Äô by helping to build smarter, cleaner renewable energy systems. Using our proprietary software platform, we help balance the supply and demand of electricity across international energy networks.

We help businesses, grid operators, asset owners and other energy stakeholders around the world reduce their carbon emissions, integrate more distributed renewable energy resources, and generate new revenue streams by participating in demand-side response services.

Learn more about us in this video.

In 2022, Sympower became a certified B Corp, which shows the company is meeting high standards of verified performance, accountability, and transparency across 5 impact areas: governance, workers, community, environment, and customers.

Sympower is an equal opportunity employer. We encourage a diverse workforce and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all team members.

Your personal data will be processed in accordance with our Privacy Policy.

MESSAGE TO RECRUITMENT AGENCIES: support for filling this position is not required, so proposals for recruitment services will not be reviewed or responded to.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
How do you delight our customers?

Bol continuously advances its platform to create a better tomorrow for over 13 million customers and over 50,000 trading partners. Our Advertising via bol (Avb) propositions, which help shoppers discover products and help advertisers reach shoppers, play an important role in bol‚Äôs ambitions ‚Äì and this is where you‚Äôll make the difference. As Avb Marketing, we help and engage thousands of our advertisers. Marketing Analytics plays an instrumental role here by creating building blocks for Marketing Automation. Our goal is to enable ‚ÄòEngagement at Scale‚Äô through data by fine-tuning queries, developing data models, and ensuring that our campaigns reach the right audience at the right time.

The biggest challenge

Advertising via Bol is growing fast and becoming increasingly important for bol. The number of colleagues, the complexity of the tech, and the breadth of initiatives are rapidly expanding. Data needs and requests for more insights are no exception. At the same time, we‚Äôre implementing Marketing Automation tools to improve our capabilities. This requires us to work pragmatically and focus on achieving the required outcomes. You rise to the occasion to ensure that our data is robust, can be used effectively and responsibly and iterate quickly.

What You‚Äôll Do As An Marketing Data Analyst

You‚Äôll join a team of marketing data analysts in bol‚Äôs Avb Marketing Analytics team, which aims to help the marketing teams to create more engaging and impactful campaigns through data.

Your Workload Covers Three Main Areas


You build, maintain and simplify our data model ‚Äì reducing complexity, making our pipelines more cost-effective and exploiting synergies between various projects. You ensure data transformations are tested, documented, monitored, performant and adhere to our security & privacy policies.
You help our marketeers by creating insights to understand customer behavior, optimize campaigns, and drive data-driven decisions. All with the goal of optimizing campaigns to help and engage advertisers.
You analyze our campaigns, all with the goal of getting a clear picture of the impact we‚Äôre making as a department.


We‚Äôre Looking For Someone Who


Can implement best practice around tools and concepts like: Git, SQL, Dbt, data testing, monitoring, and alerting, to create a state-of-the-art analytics environment that enforces quality standards.
Uses their strong communication skills to bridge the gap between Marketeers, Analysts and Product Engineers.
Doesn‚Äôt want to work alone. You help model pipelines, optimize queries, and apply best practices. You also actively collaborate within bol‚Äôs wider analytics engineering and data engineering community to improve our data stack at scale.
Practices and preaches Clean Code principles such as DRY and Clean, Clear and Concise.


3 reasons why this is (not) for you Switch to find out


No, if you‚Äôre uncomfortable with ambiguity Our data landscape evolves, and you‚Äôll need to navigate it confidently. The complexity of our organization requires you to pro-actively involve colleagues throughout our Product & Tech organization to find solutions.
No, if you prefer output over outcome If your work ends when you complete a feature ‚Äì who cares how users experience it ‚Äì than this job is not for you. You‚Äôre looking to find real solutions for our marketing teams to build solid campaigns.
No, if you‚Äôre not interested in continuous improvement We‚Äôre always learning from our analyses and work to improve our ways-of-working.
Yes, if you‚Äôve built up hands-on experience in analytics and love to share it If you have 5+ relevant experience in marketing analytics (as a data analyst, advanced analyst, or related role) and like to share your knowledge and experience with others. Experience with data engineering, analytics engineering or business intelligence engineering or experience with marketing automation tooling (such as Marigold Engage) is a plus.
Yes, if you produce high quality code & data Yes, if you have a deep interest in analytics and get excited by finetuning queries, data models, and coding principles. SQL and Git are your home away from home. Experience with Dbt is a plus.
Yes, if you can translate data to opportunity and opportunity to campaign building block Our role is multi-faceted so you‚Äôre not a one trick pony. It starts with extracting campaign opportunities from data and ends with realizing the data foundation for scalable marketing campaigns.


This is where you‚Äôll work

You‚Äôll join a team of four Marketing Data Analysts which supports our broader Avb Marketing team. Sparring with strategic and communication oriented marketeers happens on a daily basis. We work in collaborative spaces where you‚Äôll work alongside other data enthusiasts, enjoying a mix of open areas and quiet corners. Our most important stakeholders in Marketing, Sales and Product are just a stroll away.

It is our responsibility to enable an environment that unleashes the power of diversity.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
LocationUtrecht , NetherlandsBusiness SectorAIContact emailJob ref23549Published14 days ago

We are seeking a Data Analyst to join one of our clients in MedTech. The ideal candidate will be responsible for analyzing complex datasets, generating reports, and providing data-driven recommendations to support our healthcare initiatives.

Responsibilities


Analyze healthcare data to generate insights that drive clinical and business decisions.
Create reports and visualizations to communicate findings to stakeholders.
Collaborate with data scientists, engineers, and clinicians to ensure data accuracy and relevance.
Ensure compliance with healthcare data standards and regulations.
Contribute to continuous improvement of data processes and systems.



Qualifications


Proven experience as a Data Analyst, ideally within the healthcare or MedTech sector.
Strong proficiency in data analysis tools such as Excel, SQL, and data visualization platforms (e.g., Tableau, Power BI).
Experience working with healthcare data and knowledge of healthcare data standards.
Excellent analytical and problem-solving skills.
Strong communication skills with the ability to present data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
Professional proficiency in English.



Can this be interesting for you or anyone you know? If so, please send Gabriel Andrade: g.andrade@panda-int.com, your number/CV ASAP and I'll give you a call. Interviews will start next week.

Position: Data Analyst

Contract: FT

Location: Utrecht

Start Date: Immediately or by agreement

  • Uitgebreide kennis van credit risk of andere risicoanalyses
  • Ervaring met stakeholder management
  • Vaardig in Python en SQL


Wat wij bieden:

  • Uitdagende en impactvolle projecten binnen toonaangevende financi√´le instellingen
  • Een rol waarin jouw expertise en inzichten cruciaal zijn voor succes
  • Mogelijkheden om je verder te specialiseren en door te groeien
  • Een collegiale en professionele werkomgeving


Als jij klaar bent om je carri√®re naar een hoger niveau te tillen en complexe datavraagstukken aan te pakken, dan nodigen wij je uit om te solliciteren.


Voor meer informatie of om te solliciteren, mail naar info@brightstonegroup.nl.

Title: Data Specialist
Description:
My client within the Human Resources SaaS space in Utrecht are looking for an experienced analytics engineer/data specialist to help build out a new data team to help drive growth.




Responsibilities:

- Developing and managing data pipelines and ETL processes

- Managing data warehouses and databases

Ensuring the integrity and quality of data

- Managing and further development of dashboards and management information

- Performing in-depth data analyses and reports

- You will work approx. 2 days for the marketing team, 2 days for the product team and 1 day for the management team




Requirements:




‚Ä¢ Strong academic background. Ideally a masters in a related field (operations research, finance, econometrics, mathematics etc.)

‚Ä¢ Strong SQL skills

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of PowerBI/Tableau is ideal but not required

‚Ä¢ Experience as an analytics engineer would be a plus

‚Ä¢ Experience with stakeholder management is a plus but not required




Salary Package:




‚Ä¢ Up to ‚Ç¨80,000 per annum (D.O.E)

‚Ä¢ Travel allowance

‚Ä¢ 2 days per week in the office

‚Ä¢ Pension plan
