Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Over de functie

Do you want to make impact by logical thinking from a holistic view and support data driven decision making? Are you keen on analysing facts and figures to be able to understand challenges and find solutions by translating the context. Then this might be the right next step in your career!

The Data Analyst for the Integrated Management Systems team will be is responsible for analysing and interpreting data related to Vattenfall Business Area Wind Operational QHSSE Management System and . This includes, but is not limited to, data related to quality, environment, health and safety, security and resilience and other areas of the organisation's management systems and compliance to relevant standards and regulations.

The Data Analyst for the Integrated Management System plays a critical role in supporting the organisation's efforts to maintain and improve the IMS. They provide insights and recommendations that help the organisation meet its QHSSE obligations and business objectives. The ideal candidate will be highly skilled in all aspects of data analytics, including mining, generation, and visualisation.

Additionally, this person should be committed to transforming data into readable, goal-oriented reports that identify risks and opportunities to drive growth.

Place in the Organisation

As our new Data Analyst you will be reporting to the IMS Operations Lead and are part of the Integrated Management System & Process Governance team within People, Culture and Standards staff functions within Business Area Wind.

Your key responsibilities will be:


Evaluate internal systems for efficiency, problems, and inaccuracies, and develop and maintain protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data.
Collecting and analysing data related to the IMS using various tools and techniques.
Developing and maintaining dashboards and reports to monitor IMS performance.
Identifying trends and patterns in IMS data and recommending improvements.
Collaborating with stakeholders in QHSSE to improve IMS performance and work directly with managers and users to gather requirements, provide status updates, and build relationships.
Conducting research and analysis to support the development of new IMS initiatives and implement automations to decrease the number of steps required for an outcome.
Participating in the development and implementation of IMS policies, procedures, and training programs in relation to data handling and analytics.
Providing guidance and support to IMS stakeholders on data analysis and interpretation.
Work closely with project managers to understand and maintain focus on their analytics needs, including critical metrics and KPIs, and deliver actionable insights to relevant decision-makers.
Proactively analyse data to answer key questions for stakeholders or IMS team members, focussing on what drives business performance or presents risk.
Investigate and communicate which areas of data handling and analytics need improvements in efficiency and productivity.
Create and maintain rich interactive visualisations through data interpretation and analysis, with reporting components from multiple data sources.
Define and implement data acquisition and integration logic, selecting an appropriate combination of methods and tools within the defined technology stack to ensure optimal scalability and performance of the solution.
Develop and maintain databases by acquiring data from primary and secondary sources.
Stay up-to-date with emerging trends, technologies, and best practices in data handling and analytics.


Location

The team is organised internationally; the colleagues are located across all our core operating countries in the Netherlands, Denmark, Germany, UK and Sweden. Therefore it is possible to join the team in our offices in Amsterdam, Kolding, Hamburg, Berlin, London or Stockholm.

Jouw profiel

Profile

You will feel comfortable quickly in this position when you bring:


Bachelor's degree in a related field, such as environmental science, quality management, or data analytics.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency in data analysis and visualisation tools such as Excel including VBA, SQL, Tableau, or Power BI, with aptitude for learning other analytics tools. Some knowledge of Power Apps and Power Automate or Azure is a benefit.
Knowledge of applicable Management System standards, such as ISO 9001, ISO 14001, and ISO 45001 is a benefit.
Excellent communication skills, both written and verbal.
Ability to work collaboratively with diverse stakeholders.
Fluent in both written and spoken English.


Extra informatie

Our offer

Good remuneration, a challenging and international work environment, and the possibility to work with some of the best in the field. You will be working in interdisciplinary teams and you can always count on support from committed colleagues. We offer attractive employment conditions and opportunities for personal and professional development.

>> Important information

We welcome your application in English including a cover letter, before September 1. Before this date we are not likely to respond since we are in the holiday season. We only review application where a cover letter is attached, because we are keen to understand your motivation for this particular role, how is supports your personal ambition and goals, why you want to work for Vattenfall and what you have to bring to our team.

Furthermore, we would like to you to wrap your mind around some day to day challenges regarding this type of work. Please respond in your cover letter with the multiple choice answers on the 3 challenges below that you will face when you will be joining our team. These cases provide you more insights on the actual job and gives us opportunity to deepdive on these topics in our first interview rounds.

Question 1

You are required to create a dashboard in Power BI that integrates data from multiple sources, including an SQL database, an Excel spreadsheet, and an online API. Which of the following steps is crucial to ensure that your data model is optimized for performance and accuracy?


A) Loading all data sources directly into Power BI as they are received
B) Establishing relationships between the different tables after importing them into Power BI.
C) Using Power Query to clean and transform the data before loading it into Power BI.
D) Creating a single flat table in Excel that combines all data before importing into Power BI.


Question 2

Data Cleaning and Processing When developing protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data, which of the following practices is most important to ensure data accuracy?


A) Implementing validation rules to catch errors during data entry
B) Automating the data entry process
C) Removing duplicates and standardizing data formats
D) Using a single data source for analysis


Question 3

You are working on a data analysis project to develop KPI insights for multiple stakeholders in the Business. You need to ensure that the final report meets the expectations of the stakeholders with varying requirements. What is the best approach to ensure that your report is both comprehensive and understandable to all parties involved and meets expectations?


A) Use complex data visualisation to present the KPIs in the most appealing way
B) Engage with stakeholders throughout the project to gather their input and feedback, and provide a mix of high-level summaries and detailed data insights in the final report.
C) Engage with Stakeholders throughout the project and develop separate reports tailored to each stakeholder's level of data needs
D) Focus on creating a detailed report that includes all possible data, focusing on speed with minimal stakeholder engagement


We kindly request that you do not send applications by any means other than via our website as we cannot guarantee that we will be able to process applications that are not made via our website.

For more information about the recruitment process you are welcome to contact our recruiter Jurriaan Rang via email: jurriaan.rang@vattenfall.com..

At Vattenfall we are convinced that diversity contributes to build a more profitable and attractive company and we strive to be good role model regarding diversity. Vattenfall works actively for all employees to have the same opportunities and rights regardless of gender, ethnicity, age, transgender identity or expression, religion or other belief, disability or sexual orientation.

The security of Vattenfall and its employees is essential. For that reason, a pre-employment screening will be part of your recruitment process. The screening is based on the role you will fulfill within Vattenfall. The screening will be performed by a third party, Validata.

We look forward to receiving your application!

Over ons

Vattenfall is one of the largest energy companies in Europe. We make electricity and heat and supply energy to millions of customers. We do this in Sweden, Germany, the United Kingdom, France, Denmark, Finland and the Netherlands.

With around 21,000 employees, we are enabling a future in which we are less dependent on the use of fossil fuels for our energy. We are at the forefront of the transition to a sustainable energy system. To achieve this ambitious goal, we are looking for talented individuals who, in addition to their passion for their own role, also have a strong team spirit and want to contribute to supporting a meaningful company mission.

Title: Customer Intelligence Analyst
Description:
RetailSonar is a fast-growing SAAS company specializing in geomarketing for large retail and service companies. RetailSonar has offices already in 4 countries (Belgium, The Netherlands, France, Germany) and is technologically readiness for further scaling up toward European market leadership. Therefore we are looking for a Customer Intelligence Analyst to join our colleagues in the Dutch office in Utrecht.




Our unique RetailSonar platform is fed by state of the art AI technology and up-to-date marketdata, which is the base of our very accurate performance prediction.

RetailSonar is looking for suitable Dutch candidates to join its existing team of Customer Intelligence Analysts.




Your future colleagues have a great affinity with big data, data processing and predictive modelling. Our employees are true multitaskers: they work simultaneously on multiple projects at major retailers and service providers.




Your responsibilities:

Your daily tasks include validating and analysing customer data, platform configuration and building powerful predictive models.
You maintain frequent contact with the customers you work for.
Customer satisfaction is our number one priority. We achieve this by delivering high-quality end results and going the extra mile. Our analysts rise to any challenge and dare to think out-of-the-box.




Moreover, our employees are real team players: together, they always succeed in communicating the most important conclusions and insights to the client in a structured manner. Constructive feedback is important to us and we help each other to get the best out of ourselves. Every day again!




About you:

Preferably, you hold an master's degree in technical/economical or business area which is complemented by a master's degree in data technology (e.g. Data Science, Data Analytics, Business Informatics)
A first experience in a data driven position is a strong plus
You have a sharp, analytical mind
You have a passion for data processing (SQL, Excel, Access, SAS, ...)
You have enough courage, enthusiasm, persuasiveness and a corresponding language skill (NL-EN) to speak to the highest management at our (international) customers
A strong backbone that enables you to transform stressful situations into positive energy
A real team player who can also work well independently




What we have to offer:




A varied position with a steep and challenging learning curve in a particularly innovative and extremely exciting field within retail: geomarketing & customer intelligence.
A competitive salary package that is topped off every semester by a team bonus and individual bonus that encourage you to get the most out of yourself and your team.
The opportunity to be part of a young, close-knit and highly driven international team that enthusiastically builds successful, ground-breaking solutions.
A committed and personal organisation that values a good work-life balance.
A very personal coaching program that offers you ample opportunity to further explore your own interests.
The opportunity to work with executives and experts from the largest retail companies and governments. The ideal way to broaden your world.
Regular team events and trips to Belgium and beyond.

Show more

Title: BI Consultant
Description:
Word jij onze nieuwe enthousiaste BI-engineer/consultant voor Zig | Insights?




Voor het onboarden en begeleiden van nieuwe klanten op ons BI-platform Zig | Insights zijn wij op zoek naar een enthousiaste BI-engineer/consultant.

Geloof jij net als wij dat de impact van data op organisaties steeds belangrijker wordt voor het vaststellen √©n behalen van doelstellingen en het maken van strategische keuzes? Wil jij met data een verschil maken, onder andere voor de maatschappelijke doelstellingen van onze klanten en hun klanten? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!




Wat ga je doen

Jij speelt een belangrijke rol in het aansluiten van nieuwe klanten op ons BI-platform en het vertalen van hun wensen naar bestaande standaarden of refinements voor nieuwe standaarden. Samen met je collega‚Äôs en de klanten blijf je nieuwe informatieproducten ontwikkelen, zoals KPI‚Äôs en visualisaties in Fabric/PowerBI. Met het team (22 collega‚Äôs) optimaliseer je continu het platform met innovaties en nieuwe functionaliteiten.




Als BI-engineer/consultant ben je dagelijks bezig om samen met de klant het maximale uit de samenwerking en het BI-platform te halen. Een aantal taken en verantwoordelijkheden die bij jouw rol horen zijn:




Het onboarden van nieuwe klanten op het Zig | Insights platform.
Het begeleiden van het projectteam bij de klant in het begrijpen en integreren van definities/indicatoren vanuit de informatieproducten in de organisatieprocessen.
Het begeleiden van de dagstart- en dageinde-sessies met de klant en het beheer van de backlog; samen met de projectleider de voortgang bewaken.
Analyseren en implementeren van oplossingen om klanten te helpen bij het analyseren en rapporteren van hun data, met als doel inzicht te verkrijgen in de bedrijfsprocessen en betere datagedreven strategische beslissingen te nemen.
Analyseren en uitwerken van de informatiebehoefte van klanten op een duidelijke en gestructureerde manier, en deze behoeften vertalen naar gedetailleerde specificaties om oplossingen te ontwikkelen die aansluiten bij de behoeften van de klanten.
Het ontzorgen van de klant in het proces van data ontsluiting, data preparatie en het bouwen aan integrale informatievoorziening.
Fungeren als interne specialist op het gebied van business intelligence, waarbij je voortdurend de nieuwste ontwikkelingen en trends binnen dit vakgebied volgt om je deskundigheid te maximaliseren.




Dit ben jij

Jij vindt het leuk om in een team te werken dat een sterke visie heeft om de vastgoedsector via data te professionaliseren. Je hebt een passie voor data en wilt deze graag delen met klanten. Je wilt hen helpen om meer datagedreven te werken en te groeien naar een datagedreven organisatie. Jij kunt de vertaalslag maken van klantvragen naar te ontwikkelen indicatoren en dashboards.




Als BI-engineer/consultant beschik je over de volgende kennis en ervaring:

HBO- of WO-werk- en denkniveau (bij voorkeur in de richting bedrijfskunde, informatica, data science of toegepaste wiskunde)
Minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring in de richting van Business Intelligence en/of data analytics
Ervaring met data-visualisatie-tooling (bijvoorbeeld Power BI)
Sterke analytische en communicatieve vaardigheden
Vloeiend in Nederlands, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk




Een dikke pr√© is als je een achtergrond of kennis hebt in finance en/of goed bent in het overzien van processen.




Wat is Zig | Insights?

Zig Insights is h√©t innovatieve BI-platform voor de vastgoedsector. We begeleiden organisaties bij het verwerken van data tot waardevolle informatie, op een eenduidige en gestructureerde manier, waarbij we de standaarden van de sector gebruiken. Het BI-team van Zig helpt klanten met de stappen die nodig zijn om een datagedreven cultuur te cre√´ren.




Onze dataspecialisten hebben de drive en ambitie om zichzelf steeds opnieuw uit te vinden en werken continu aan het verbeteren en optimaliseren van producten en diensten. Samen maken we mooie dingen. De collega‚Äôs binnen het team zijn een beetje eigenwijs, hebben humor, maar houden altijd de focus op het resultaat van de klant.




Wie zijn wij?

Wij zijn Zig. We ontwikkelen software voor de vastgoedbranche (woningcorporaties, studentenhuisvesters en commercieel vastgoed) en doen dit met veel plezier.




Wij helpen organisaties om dichter bij hun klanten te komen met slimme processen, innovatieve technologie√´n en data. Onze digitale oplossingen zorgen ervoor dat de focus op de klant zichtbaar en voelbaar is in het complete proces: van een woning zoeken en vinden tot aan bewonen en verhuizen. Wij maken wonen makkelijker.




Dit doen wij al meer dan 14 jaar met een enthousiast team van ruim 300 specialisten die werken in Huizen, Veenendaal en hybride. Meer dan 160 vastgoedorganisaties en 1,6 miljoen mensen maken gebruik van onze software.




Dit krijg je ervoor terug




Wij bespreken graag jouw salariswens tijdens onze eerste kennismaking. Het salaris ligt tussen de ‚Ç¨ 4500 en ‚Ç¨ 5500 op basis van een 40-urige werkweek, afhankelijk van jouw kennis en ervaring.
Ruimte om mee te denken over de doorontwikkeling van onze producten en jouw kennis te delen;
Ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen via de Zig Academy;
Werken bij een 'Great place to work', een bedrijf met ambitie en een sterke visie;
Een fijne sfeer binnen een organisatie die altijd in beweging is;
De mogelijkheid om je werkplek en -tijd flexibel in te delen;
26 vakantiedagen (bij een fulltime dienstverband);
Een goede pensioenregeling;
Samenwerken met 300 gemotiveerde en gedreven collega‚Äôs, ze vertellen je graag waarom Zig de juiste keuze is.




Overtuigd? Laat het ons weten!

Ben jij ervan overtuigd dat jij goed past bij de functie en bij ons als organisatie? Dan is het tijd om in actie te komen. Wacht dan niet langer en solliciteer direct met je LinkedIn profiel.




Wil je eerst meer informatie voordat je solliciteert? Geen probleem. Je kunt altijd contact opnemen met Saskia Kronenburg, onze recruiter bij Zig. Ze is telefonisch of via WhatsApp bereikbaar op 06-41611022.

Show more
HTML:
Word jij onze nieuwe enthousiaste BI-engineer/consultant voor Zig | Insights?


Voor het onboarden en begeleiden van nieuwe klanten op ons BI-platform Zig | Insights zijn wij op zoek naar een enthousiaste BI-engineer/consultant.

Geloof jij net als wij dat de impact van data op organisaties steeds belangrijker wordt voor het vaststellen √©n behalen van doelstellingen en het maken van strategische keuzes? Wil jij met data een verschil maken, onder andere voor de maatschappelijke doelstellingen van onze klanten en hun klanten? Dan zijn wij op zoek naar jou!


Wat ga je doen

Jij speelt een belangrijke rol in het aansluiten van nieuwe klanten op ons BI-platform en het vertalen van hun wensen naar bestaande standaarden of refinements voor nieuwe standaarden. Samen met je collega‚Äôs en de klanten blijf je nieuwe informatieproducten ontwikkelen, zoals KPI‚Äôs en visualisaties in Fabric/PowerBI. Met het team (22 collega‚Äôs) optimaliseer je continu het platform met innovaties en nieuwe functionaliteiten.


Als BI-engineer/consultant ben je dagelijks bezig om samen met de klant het maximale uit de samenwerking en het BI-platform te halen. Een aantal taken en verantwoordelijkheden die bij jouw rol horen zijn:


  • Het onboarden van nieuwe klanten op het Zig | Insights platform.
  • Het begeleiden van het projectteam bij de klant in het begrijpen en integreren van definities/indicatoren vanuit de informatieproducten in de organisatieprocessen.
  • Het begeleiden van de dagstart- en dageinde-sessies met de klant en het beheer van de backlog; samen met de projectleider de voortgang bewaken.
  • Analyseren en implementeren van oplossingen om klanten te helpen bij het analyseren en rapporteren van hun data, met als doel inzicht te verkrijgen in de bedrijfsprocessen en betere datagedreven strategische beslissingen te nemen.
  • Analyseren en uitwerken van de informatiebehoefte van klanten op een duidelijke en gestructureerde manier, en deze behoeften vertalen naar gedetailleerde specificaties om oplossingen te ontwikkelen die aansluiten bij de behoeften van de klanten.
  • Het ontzorgen van de klant in het proces van data ontsluiting, data preparatie en het bouwen aan integrale informatievoorziening.
  • Fungeren als interne specialist op het gebied van business intelligence, waarbij je voortdurend de nieuwste ontwikkelingen en trends binnen dit vakgebied volgt om je deskundigheid te maximaliseren.


Dit ben jij

Jij vindt het leuk om in een team te werken dat een sterke visie heeft om de vastgoedsector via data te professionaliseren. Je hebt een passie voor data en wilt deze graag delen met klanten. Je wilt hen helpen om meer datagedreven te werken en te groeien naar een datagedreven organisatie. Jij kunt de vertaalslag maken van klantvragen naar te ontwikkelen indicatoren en dashboards.


Als BI-engineer/consultant beschik je over de volgende kennis en ervaring:

  • HBO- of WO-werk- en denkniveau (bij voorkeur in de richting bedrijfskunde, informatica, data science of toegepaste wiskunde)
  • Minimaal 3 jaar werkervaring in de richting van Business Intelligence en/of data analytics
  • Ervaring met data-visualisatie-tooling (bijvoorbeeld Power BI)
  • Sterke analytische en communicatieve vaardigheden
  • Vloeiend in Nederlands, zowel mondeling als schriftelijk


Een dikke pr√© is als je een achtergrond of kennis hebt in finance en/of goed bent in het overzien van processen.


Wat is Zig | Insights?

Zig Insights is h√©t innovatieve BI-platform voor de vastgoedsector. We begeleiden organisaties bij het verwerken van data tot waardevolle informatie, op een eenduidige en gestructureerde manier, waarbij we de standaarden van de sector gebruiken. Het BI-team van Zig helpt klanten met de stappen die nodig zijn om een datagedreven cultuur te cre√´ren.


Onze dataspecialisten hebben de drive en ambitie om zichzelf steeds opnieuw uit te vinden en werken continu aan het verbeteren en optimaliseren van producten en diensten. Samen maken we mooie dingen. De collega‚Äôs binnen het team zijn een beetje eigenwijs, hebben humor, maar houden altijd de focus op het resultaat van de klant.


Wie zijn wij?

Wij zijn Zig. We ontwikkelen software voor de vastgoedbranche (woningcorporaties, studentenhuisvesters en commercieel vastgoed) en doen dit met veel plezier.


Wij helpen organisaties om dichter bij hun klanten te komen met slimme processen, innovatieve technologie√´n en data. Onze digitale oplossingen zorgen ervoor dat de focus op de klant zichtbaar en voelbaar is in het complete proces: van een woning zoeken en vinden tot aan bewonen en verhuizen. Wij maken wonen makkelijker.


Dit doen wij al meer dan 14 jaar met een enthousiast team van ruim 300 specialisten die werken in Huizen, Veenendaal en hybride. Meer dan 160 vastgoedorganisaties en 1,6 miljoen mensen maken gebruik van onze software.


Dit krijg je ervoor terug


  • Wij bespreken graag jouw salariswens tijdens onze eerste kennismaking. Het salaris ligt tussen de ‚Ç¨ 4500 en ‚Ç¨ 5500 op basis van een 40-urige werkweek, afhankelijk van jouw kennis en ervaring.
  • Ruimte om mee te denken over de doorontwikkeling van onze producten en jouw kennis te delen;
  • Ruimte om jezelf te ontwikkelen via de Zig Academy;
  • Werken bij een 'Great place to work', een bedrijf met ambitie en een sterke visie;
  • Een fijne sfeer binnen een organisatie die altijd in beweging is;
  • De mogelijkheid om je werkplek en -tijd flexibel in te delen;
  • 26 vakantiedagen (bij een fulltime dienstverband);
  • Een goede pensioenregeling;
  • Samenwerken met 300 gemotiveerde en gedreven collega‚Äôs, ze vertellen je graag waarom Zig de juiste keuze is.


Overtuigd? Laat het ons weten!

Ben jij ervan overtuigd dat jij goed past bij de functie en bij ons als organisatie? Dan is het tijd om in actie te komen. Wacht dan niet langer en solliciteer direct met je LinkedIn profiel.


Wil je eerst meer informatie voordat je solliciteert? Geen probleem. Je kunt altijd contact opnemen met Saskia Kronenburg, onze recruiter bij Zig. Ze is telefonisch of via WhatsApp bereikbaar op 06-41611022.

Title: BI-Consultant
Description:
BI Consultant bij Adapt Analytics

‚Ç¨4500,- tot ‚Ç¨6500,- per maand - Zeist - Een leven lang leren!




Heb jij minimaal 4 jaar ervaring binnen BI en werk jij graag in een dynamische, innovatieve omgeving met volop kansen voor professionele groei? Bij Adapt analytics geloven we in een leven lang leren en bieden we een unieke, ontspannen cultuur waar vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid centraal staan. Ons diverse team van dataspecialisten werkt aan uitdagende projecten voor uiteenlopende klanten. Klinkt dit als jouw ideale werkplek? Lees dan snel verder en ontdek wat Adapt Analytics jou te bieden heeft!




Wat jij gaat doen

Als BI Consultant bij Adapt Analytics speel je een cruciale rol in het helpen van onze klanten om hun data optimaal te benutten. Je werkt aan uiteenlopende opdrachten bij onze klanten. Dit zijn MKB-bedrijven of gemeenten, maar ook grote organisaties zoals Schiphol en de ING bank. Jouw werkzaamheden omvatten:

Data modelleren en analyseren om bedrijfsprocessen te verbeteren en waardevolle inzichten te genereren.
Schrijven van complexe queries in SQL en werken met tools zoals Azure Data Factory en PowerBI.
Adviseren van klanten over datastrategie√´n en het ophalen van requirements bij stakeholders.
Implementeren van data gedreven oplossingen en samenwerken in agile/scrum teams.




Waar je terecht komt

Je komt terecht in een dynamisch en divers team van dataspecialisten. Ons team bestaat uit ervaren professionals die graag hun kennis delen en samenwerken aan innovatieve projecten. Wij hechten veel waarde aan een inclusieve cultuur waarin iedereen zich welkom voelt. Onze cultuur is uniek, ontspannen en gebaseerd op vertrouwen, wat zorgt voor een prettige en productieve werkomgeving. Ons kantoor in Zeist is een inspirerende werkplek waar we wekelijks gezamenlijke lunch organiseren en waar regelmatig sociale en kennisactiviteiten plaatsvinden. Bij Adapt Analytics krijg je de flexibiliteit om je werkweek in te delen in overleg met de klant.




Wie jij bent

Je hebt minimaal een HBO-opleiding afgerond.
Je hebt 4 jaar werkervaring met SQL, data modeling en data visualisatietools zoals PowerBI, Tableau of Qlik.
Ervaring in de consultancy is een pre.
Je beheerst zowel het Nederlands als het Engels uitstekend.
Je bent proactief, overtuigend, nieuwsgierig, zelfstandig en een goede gesprekspartner.
Je hebt een passie voor data en helpt graag anderen om data gedreven te werken.




Wat wij bieden

Direct een vast contract met 2 maanden proeftijd.
Salaris tussen ‚Ç¨4500,- en ‚Ç¨6500,- per maand afhankelijk van jouw ervaring.
Ontvang een percentage over jouw gerealiseerde omzet.
Een elektrische auto van de zaak (bijvoorbeeld een Tesla Model 3) of een alternatieve mobiliteitsvergoeding.
‚Ç¨500,- bruto per jaar voor de inrichting van je thuiswerkplek.
Werk 2 tot 3 dagen per week vanuit huis, afhankelijk van jouw lopende opdracht.
Een premievrije pensioenregeling.
26 vakantiedagen o.b.v. fulltime + 1 extra dag voor je verjaardag (√≥√≥k als deze in het weekend valt).
Een prachtig kantoor in Zeist met wekelijks gezamenlijke lunch en diverse sociale en kennisactiviteiten.
Een ruim opleidingsbudget van ‚Ç¨5000 per jaar o.b.v. fulltime om jezelf doorlopend te ontwikkelen.
Een cultuur van vrijheid en verantwoordelijkheid, waarin je de ruimte krijgt om je eigen idee√´n te realiseren en te groeien in je rol.




Hoe nu verder

Ben jij de professional die we zoeken? Heb je een passie voor data en wil je deel uitmaken van een dynamisch en divers team? Stuur je CV en motivatiebrief naar anne@adapt.nl en word onderdeel van Adapt analytics! Voor vragen over deze vacature kun je contact opnemen met Anne, onze recruiter, via 06 1613 6164 of per mail.

Let op: voor deze vacature is het een vereiste dat je de Nederlandse taal beheerst op minimaal B2 niveau. Sollicitanten die her niet aan voldoen worden niet in behandeling genomen.

Title: Commercial Data & Reporting analyst
Description:
Commercial Data and Reporting Analyst (m/f/d)

Scope of Position:

The sales operations team drives sales efficiency globally, through metrics, training, CRM and cross functional alignment. Within this team, the role of the Commercial Data and Reporting Analyst is to serve as a bridge connecting internal/external customers with business related reports and information. Comfortable utilizing performance excellence tools, they also bridge the gap between business needs and technology solutions. Their primary focus is on leveraging PBI, Salesforce and other sales and reporting technologies to optimize and streamline business processes. They are playing an active role in transforming some of our current manual operation tools into automatic IT solutions. They should have a strong subject matter understanding of commercial operations processes, tools, and systems.

Day to Day Responsibilities:

Sales Incentive Plan processes
Administer sales incentive programs
Manage the day-to-day administration of sales incentive programs
This includes tracking performance metrics and ensuring that incentive data is accurate and up to date
Develop and maintain tools to drive annual budget cycle
Monthly build of data cube for SIP processing
Collaborate with Commercial Reporting team and Sales managers to identify new customers and update mapping files
Support quarterly transfer meeting with Sales managers and load subsequent, approved corrections
Coordinate escalations as required to resolve unapproved correction requests
Support quarterly reviews with Sales Leadership, HR, and Finance to share performance results and deeper analyses such as observed trends, themes, and potential focus areas that may lead to future plan optimization
Capture, troubleshoot, report out and correct any errors identified by sales managers
Provide training and support to the Commercial team on the use of IT Sales Incentive Planning systems
Collaborate with IT and the data analytics team to ensure the accuracy and integrity of sales data. Sales intelligence
Develop, manage, and communicate reporting and analytics critical to the commercial organization
Act as a liaison between business stakeholders and technical teams, translating business requirements into technical specifications
Work together with cross-functional teams, stakeholders, and IT professionals to gather, analyze, and document business requirements, ensuring the successful implementation and enhancement of solutions
Act as the subject matter expert for sales technology platforms, providing guidance and best practices to ensure optimal system performance and data integrity
Identifies gaps and provides technical expertise in business requirements for system functional specifications and scales new and current systems, processes, and procedures in a cost-effective manner

Education and experience requirement:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Finance, Management of Information Systems, Systems Engineering
Technical education and experience in query tools, data compilation and manipulation for trend analysis and suggested solutions
3-5 years Data Analytics experience
Knowledge and experience with sales and sales processes (inclusive of Sales Incentive Plans)
Knowledge of CRM systems, ERP systems, and other sales-related software
Familiarity with Agile and Scrum methodologies
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills (customer focused, enabling, engaging)
Ability to work/build relationships in an international multi-cultural matrix organization
Results oriented, detailed oriented, rigorous, forward looking
Excellent analytical skills
Advanced knowledge of PowerBI, Power Query functionality and Excel




Travel Requirements: Minimal travel required

Hours of work/work schedule/flex-time: Monday ‚Äì Friday (40 hours/week)

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The job

As a Data Analyst, you will play a crucial role in making data accessible and understandable across the company. Your key responsibilities will include:


Developing and managing dashboards and analyses to support strategic business initiatives using PowerBI and Databricks.
Conducting exploratory data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and actionable insights.
Collaborating with internal stakeholders to understand their data needs and translating these into impactful solutions.
Contributing to cross-functional projects and initiatives within the Network team.
Ensuring data quality by working with data engineers to establish custom data quality rules and validations.
Leading projects and mentoring junior team members to foster continuous learning and improvement.



Who We‚Äôre Looking For:


You hold an MSc in mathematics, econometrics, statistics, data science, or a related field.
You have at least 5 years of experience in data analysis, with proficiency in SQL and hands-on experience with Databricks and PowerBI.
You possess strong analytical, strategic, and storytelling skills, with the ability to communicate complex data effectively.
You excel in building relationships and working collaboratively with stakeholders at all levels.
Experience with Dynamics 365 CRM and knowledge in logistics, navigation, or fleet management is a plus.
You are eager to immerse yourself in the electric trucking market, with a strong alignment to our values: reliability, sustainability, approachability, progressiveness, and a fast-paced work ethic.
Fluency in English is required; additional European languages are advantageous.



What We Offer:


The chance to join a purpose-driven company at a pivotal moment, with opportunities to shape our future.
A dynamic and supportive work environment with ample room for personal growth and development.
Comprehensive benefits, including a pension plan, unlimited vacation days, and flexible (hybrid) working arrangements.



Ready to Join Us? If you are passionate about shaping the future of sustainable transport and meet the above criteria, we encourage you to apply. Please submit your resum√© in English. At Milence, we value diversity and welcome applicants from all backgrounds.

Title: Data Analist
Description:
Wat ga je doen?
Heb je passie voor data en ga je geen uitdaging uit de weg? Zet je jouw expertise in om groei te stimuleren op basis van jouw analyses? Dan zou jij wel eens de Data Analist kunnen zijn die we zoeken!
In deze rol speel je een sleutelrol in het verbeteren van de bedrijfsresultaten door data te analyseren en trends te ontdekken. Je houdt de KPI's zoals CTA en NPV in de gaten, rapporteert over je bevindingen en adviseert afdelingen op basis van jouw analyses. Je werkt nauw samen met het BI Team en benut moderne analytics tools op ons cloudplatform (Azure).
Jouw taken:

Analyseren en interpreteren van trends en patronen in data
Genereren en testen van hypotheses op basis van exploratieve analyses
Monitoren en rapporteren van KPI's zoals CTA en NPV
Adviseren van afdelingen om data-gedreven beslissingen te verbeteren

Wat breng je mee?

Minimaal 1 jaar relevante ervaring
Ervaring met SQL en Power BI
Sterke analytische vaardigheden en probleemoplossend vermogen
Vaardigheid in het presenteren van inzichten en het nemen van data-gedreven beslissingen
Zelfstartend en goed in een commerci√´le en dynamische omgeving

Title: Data & Analytics Consultant
Description:
Sia Partners is a specialist Management Consulting firm created in 1999 and has grown into a global firm with approximately 2800 employees and annual revenue exceeding $400m. Our culture is strongly orientated towards high-quality expertise and delivering excellent results and outcomes for our clients, which include a wide range of multinational companies. Our global presence and our expertise in more than 40 sectors and services allows us to accompany clients worldwide. Using innovative technologies such as our own in-house apps, social networks, and digital tools, we provide a truly integrated global service.

Through Consulting for Good, we put our expertise at the service of our clients' climate objectives and make sustainable development a performance lever for our clients. Our portfolio of offerings is cross-sectors and 17 % of our revenue is generated from engagements with a CSR focus.






Job Description



Who will you be working with?
The Amsterdam Data Science team is young, diverse and growing. You will work in a team that challenges you and invests in your professional development. We have a flat structure and rely on the entrepreneurial spirit of our colleagues. Taking the initiative is strongly encouraged. We strive for well-being, diversity and knowledge sharing within the team, so that we can grow together.

What you are going to do
As a Data & Analytics Consultant, you will work with our Data Scientists, Data Engineers and other consultants at Sia Partners, on various client projects in multidisciplinary teams. You will use your analytical mindset and data skills to solve complex business problems and deliver actionable insights.

Responsibilities include:

Work closely with Sia consultants on assignments with an analytical challenge
Identify business problems by extracting, interpreting and explaining insights from data
Develop statistical and analytical methods to solve specific operational problems
Ensure that the deep insights generated from advanced analytics translate into business impact
Present results and conduct workshops at customer sites

Who you are

You want to make business impact, not only by doing data analysis, but also by making recommendations through inspiring presentations
You have the ability to adapt quickly and work across different business areas within a challenging environment
You have exceptional analytical and quantitative problem solving skills
You have the ability to work collaboratively in a team environment
You have excellent communication skills and can present complex concepts in a synthetic way
You have a good track record of leadership in an academic, professional or extracurricular setting.


Qualifications



What you need

Completed WO Master's degree in Statistics, Econometrics, Economics, Business Analytics or a related field of study.
You are a young graduate or already have several years of experience in a similar position.
Good skills in Python and at least one other analytical language (e.g. R, SQL)
Experience with data visualization and reporting (e.g. Tableau, Power BI)
Knowledge of Machine Learning techniques or optimization is a strong plus
Fluent in English and Dutch, both written and oral. Additional languages are a strong plus.

What we offer

Training opportunities to develop yourself further
Opportunities to work on international assignments
Flexible working hours
A meritocratic approach to promotion
Performance related bonus
An attractive package (e.g. lease car, health insurance, pension scheme)


Additional Information



We are unable to provide a work permit for this position

Non-Dutch speaker will unfortunately not be accepted

Sia Partners is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment, including hiring, promotion, remuneration, or discipline, are based solely on performance, competence, conduct, or business needs.

Title: Data-analist
Description:
Data Consultant: werken als Data Engineer, Data Analyst, Bi Consultant of Data Scientist?




Ben jij op zoek naar een nieuwe uitdaging met afwisseling √©n een goede werk-priv√©balans? Dan zou Datamo wel eens de plek voor jou kunnen zijn! Bij Datamo haal je het beste uit jezelf door veel kennis en ervaring op te doen bij toonaangevende organisaties. Samen met jou stellen we een persoonlijk ontwikkelplan op, zodat je specifieke expertise kunt opdoen en de gewenste opleidingen kunt volgen.




Ontvang bij Datamo een compleet pakket, zoals een salaris tot ‚Ç¨ 7.000 bruto per maand, jaarlijks 35 vrij op te nemen dagen, en bepaal zelf hoe je naar je opdrachtgevers reist met behulp van een mobiliteitsbudget, vrij te besteden voor eigen vervoer of een leaseauto (zoals een Tesla Model 3).




De functie

Als Data Consultant bij Datamo krijg je de kans om jouw talenten te benutten en waardevolle ervaring op te doen bij diverse spraakmakende opdrachtgevers als financi√´le instellingen zoals de ING of overheidsorganisaties zoals ministeries of overige organisaties zoals KLM, NS en nog veel meer. Bij Datamo werk je op projectbasis, van 3 maanden tot 1 jaar, of indien gewenst zelfs langer. Je werkt in diverse rollen, zoals Data Engineer, Data Analyst of Data Scientist, afhankelijk van jouw voorkeur, ervaring en expertise. Voor wat jouw specifieke opdracht betreft zullen wij verschillende keuzes aan je voorleggen. Jij bepaalt uiteindelijk helemaal zelf welke opdracht je gaat uitvoeren, want wij willen niets liever dan dat jij op een plek zit die helemaal bij je past




Jouw taken

Het exacte takenpakket hangt volledig af van de opdracht die je gaat vervullen en natuurlijk ook van de organisatie waarvoor je aan de slag gaat.




Onderstaande taken kun je onder andere verwachten bij verschillende rollen als Data Consultant:

‚Ä¢ Data analyseren om belangrijke patronen en trends te ontdekken

‚Ä¢ Data Clustering, Data Mining en Data Visualisatie.

‚Ä¢ Gesprekspartner zijn voor eindgebruikers om visualisaties optimaal te maken

‚Ä¢ Data integreren voor het optimaliseren van analyses.

‚Ä¢ Advies verstrekken over het effectief gebruiken van data voor besluitvorming.

‚Ä¢ Rapporten opstellen om complexe data inzichtelijk te maken voor collega‚Äôs.

‚Ä¢ Het ontwikkelen van producten en innovatieve modellen goed laten samengaan met software-oplossingen.




Wie zoeken wij?

Wij zoeken een enthousiaste en leergierige collega die het leuk vindt projectmatig ervaring op te doen in diverse branches, organisaties en functies. Daarnaast:

Heb je minimaal 2 jaar relevante werkervaring.
Ben je in het bezit van een hbo-/wo-diploma.
Ben je in staat goede relaties op te bouwen en te onderhouden met onze opdrachtgevers.
Weet jij wel raad met Python, R, VBA, JavaScript, Power BI (Tableau, Qlik), SQL, Excel en Azure/AWS.
Beschik je over sterke communicatieve vaardigheden.
Heb je een uitstekende beheersing van de Nederlandse taal (schrijven en spreken).




Wat kun je verwachten van Datamo?

Datamo is onderdeel van de grotere ‚ÄòThuis van‚Äô-formule, wat betekent dat je onderdeel bent van een grotere organisatie bestaande uit 75 collega‚Äôs, die werkzaam zijn bij Datamo (Data Specialisten), Entrador (Business Analisten), Specktor (Product Owners) en Strates (Roostersoftware Specialisten). Onderling delen we kennis en netwerk met elkaar. Allen met dezelfde normen en waarden: het cre√´ren van een thuisgevoel, het beste uit iedereen halen door jou zo goed mogelijk te faciliteren.




Datamo is een platte organisatie, je vindt bij ons geen onnodige directie of managementlagen, maar wel korte communicatielijnen. Jouw potentieel en geluk staan centraal, en wij willen jou daar graag in ondersteunen. Je bent bij ons zeker geen nummer, maar wel een hele belangrijke collega!

En laten we eerlijk zijn, bij Datamo wordt ‚Äúdata crunchen‚Äù ineens een stuk gezelliger. We combineren vakinhoudelijke ontwikkeling met sociale activiteiten, zodat je niet alleen groeit in je vakgebied, maar ook in je connecties binnen het team. We organiseren regelmatig groepsactiviteiten waarbij geldt dat je niet moet, maar mag deelnemen!

Last but not least‚Ä¶ Bij Datamo is de balans tussen werk en priv√© erg belangrijk. Niet voor niets geven we je 35 vrij op te nemen dagen per jaar en overwerken staat niet in ons vocabulaire.




Wat bieden wij jou?

Een uitstekend salaris tussen de ‚Ç¨ 4.500 en ‚Ç¨ 7.000 bruto per maand, bestaande uit een vast en een variabel component.
35 vrij op te nemen dagen per jaar.
Een meer dan goede pensioenregeling.
Mobiliteitsbudget, vrij te besteden voor flexibel zakelijk vervoer: NS, fiets, taxi, Uber, deelauto, je eigen auto etc. en/of te besteden voor een eigen leaseauto.
Een MacBook Air.
Een maandelijkse telefoonvergoeding.
Gezellige uitjes, georganiseerd door en voor Datamo collega‚Äôs!
Waardevolle (in-house) trainings- en kennissessies.
Goede opleidingsmogelijkheden, ‚Äò‚Äôthe sky is the limit‚Äô‚Äô.
Meerdere interessante bonusregelingen voor bijvoorbeeld het aandragen van nieuwe collega‚Äôs.
Een fijne werkplek in ons monumentale pand in het centrum van het mooie Amersfoort.




Enthousiast geworden?

Klaar voor een nieuwe uitdaging? Solliciteer nu en haal alles uit jouw carri√®re met interessante projecten en kansen om je vaardigheden te ontwikkelen!

Wil je eerst vrijblijvend met een van je toekomstige collega‚Äôs praten over waarom je bij Datamo zou willen werken en wat zij doen qua opdrachten? Dat kan natuurlijk ook! We brengen je graag in contact!.

Show more

Title: Data Analyst Intern
Description:
Data Analyst Intern, within the team of People Analytics and Workforce Transformation (Group HR).

As Data Analyst Intern you will work on building advanced analytics and reporting assets that span across the HR domain such as performance management, talent, rewards, learning and Diversity, Equity & Inclusion.

Day To Day


Collect the requirements from the business and HR stakeholders.
Responsible for the technical development and maintenance of advanced analytics and reporting assets.
Carry out data analyses based on available raw data and management information.
Support the deployment of our Strategic Workforce planning practice.
Support the implementation of CSRD reporting.
Hybrid way of working, in the office and from home.
You will experience working in a ‚ÄòAgile‚Äô way.


‚ÄúExperience is not everything, we need candidates with an open, adaptable mindset.‚Äù

Essentials


Studying Econometrics, (Business) Economics, IT, Data Sciences or a comparable study.
Preferably graduation student
Advanced knowledge of MS Excel
Advanced knowledge of Power BI
Knowledge of Python
Knowledge of analytical tools and systems (SPSS, R, SQL, Stata, Databricks, Azure Cloud, etc.) or similar analysis software package.
Experience or interest in HR and People practices.
Demonstrated problem solving skills and result oriented.
Good interpersonal and communication skills.
Fluent in English (verbal and written)
Able to work in an international environment


Compensation

The internship will start in September 2024 but could be flexible towards later in 2024. You will receive an internship allowance of ‚Ç¨350 - ‚Ç¨500 gross per month, based on your educational level.

DLL In a Nutshell

DLL is a global vendor finance company with more than EUR 30 billion in assets. Founded in 1969 and headquartered in Eindhoven, The Netherlands, we provide asset-based financial solutions in the Agriculture, Food, Healthcare, Clean technology, Construction, Transportation, Industrial and Office technology industries.

We partner with equipment manufacturers, dealers and distributors in more than 30 countries to support their distribution channels and help grow their businesses.

We combine customer focus with deep industry knowledge to deliver sustainable solutions for the complete asset life cycle, including retail finance, commercial finance and used equipment finance. DLL is a wholly owned subsidiary of Rabobank Group.

Good To Know


Deadline for applications: August/September 2024
Applications via email will not be reviewed. Please apply online via our career website
Students on work placement are paid a work placement allowance.
Start date can be discussed.
For more information you can contact Pim Meeuwis, Intern Coordinator, via intern.recruitment@dllgroup.com


For this internship, it is important that you are studying at a University in the Netherlands.

Screening is part of the application procedure and DLL screens all interns and new employees according to the ‚ÄúDLL Global Screening Policy‚Äù in order to ascertain whether the applicant may hold a position at DLL.

Title: Data Analyst at Travel Company
Description:
In this role you will get an opportunity to closely with some very talented data analysts, data engineers and data scientists to support the reporting and analytics needs of the Partner Services department. You will also work on delivering one of the company's priority topics related to financial technology and GTM regulatory matters

Data Analysts are the drivers of how data is leveraged in solving business problems within their area. They are able to use their experience to consult with stakeholders in problem-definition, setting success metrics and shaping the way forward through data insights and effective communication with their audience. Data Analysts are able to manage stakeholders largely autonomously (seeking for help in complex scenarios) based on their experience by prioritizing business impact, efficiently adapting to business needs, and managing expectations accordingly. They can use their deep practical understanding of the data, workflows, methods and tooling to autonomously drive analysis and reporting within their scope. They can adapt their tooling and approach based on business and user needs. This involves reporting, visualization and taking ownership of workflows and structures to make their solutions scalable, reproducible and long-term focused. They collaborate with peers in their craft and support initiatives for data quality and stability, using their experience to think of scalable solutions.

Key Responsibilities

Works independently on data collection and preparation.
Uses their past experience and seeks for help in complex scenarios to translate business problems into data stories Maintains and drives key reports, metrics and workflows running within their scope.
Is able to communicate results and outcomes clearly to stakeholders based on their knowledge and experience.
Communicates effectively, collaboratively and challenges constructively to create rapport and establish trust.
Actively participates in business and/or analytics team activities and suggests ways of achieving objectives (standup, planning meeting, retrospectives) Networks and proactively connects with craft peers beyond the team scope Uses previous knowledge and experience on data analysis and visualization to answer business questions in the most efficient way Is aware and has experience working in our experimentation culture, process and results interpretation Is aware of statistical models used within their scope Is familiar with the larger data ecosystem at the organisation and how it relates to their data and the work they do.
Collaborates and is open to giving and receiving feedback with peers and direct stakeholders.
Is flexible in adopting and proposing new approaches and expanding their technical competencies when a more efficient way presents itself.
Expected to get significant deep knowledge about the operational, tactical and strategic workings of the department. Has a main focus on business and technical opportunities.
Responsible for data management related Data Governance processes as defined in the Data Governance Framework (E.g. monitoring of data quality, management of data lineage, and maintenance of logical data model).

Requirements of special knowledge/skills

Driven and results oriented personality Open to feedback and always looking for ways to improve own performance Able to understand details while keeping an eye on the bigger picture Analytical and curious mindset Strong interpersonal skills Open and friendly attitude Strong knowledge and experience on data analysis.
Experience in data management, data visualization and quality.
Knowledge and experience using data analysis and visualization tools (e.g: tableau, data studio, powerbi, etc)
Knowledge and experience with at least one data analysis language (e.g: SQL, Pyspark etc)

Does this sound like you? Please apply with your most recent CV and earliest availability.

Show more

  • Collaborates and is open to giving and receiving feedback with peers and direct stakeholders.
  • Is flexible in adopting and proposing new approaches and expanding their technical competencies when a more efficient way presents itself.
  • Expected to get significant deep knowledge about the operational, tactical and strategic workings of the department. Has a main focus on business and technical opportunities.
  • Responsible for data management related Data Governance processes as defined in the Data Governance Framework (E.g. monitoring of data quality, management of data lineage, and maintenance of logical data model).

Requirements of special knowledge/skills

  • Driven and results oriented personality Open to feedback and always looking for ways to improve own performance Able to understand details while keeping an eye on the bigger picture Analytical and curious mindset Strong interpersonal skills Open and friendly attitude Strong knowledge and experience on data analysis.
  • Experience in data management, data visualization and quality.
  • Knowledge and experience using data analysis and visualization tools (e.g: tableau, data studio, powerbi, etc)
  • Knowledge and experience with at least one data analysis language (e.g: SQL, Pyspark etc)

Does this sound like you? Please apply with your most recent CV and earliest availability.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At BESTSELLER we are looking for a Data Analyst to join our international E-commerce team in Amsterdam or Aarhus.

BESTSELLER is one of Europe‚Äôs largest fashion companies with a wide variety of brands, including VERO MODA, ONLY, SELECTED and JACK & JONES. From Amsterdam, we support all BESTSELLER brands in growing and optimizing their E-commerce activities. You will be part of an open, dynamic, and international environment, where every day brings new and interesting challenges.

(Note: we would need you to be eligible to work in the EU for this job)

WHAT COULD YOU EXPECT FROM US?

As a Data Analyst in our team, you will act as a bridge between business and tech teams to drive data-driven decision-making. Hereby, you will gain experience in each step of the process, from collecting the data to delivering business insights.

At BESTSELLER E-Commerce we believe in freedom with responsibility, so we own what we do and how we develop ourselves.

WHAT DO WE NEED FROM YOU?

Responsibilities


Building reports and analyses to support various business teams (Performance Marketing, Consumer and Growth)
Presenting insights & recommendations to decision-makers
Translating business questions into analytical problems
Writing technical requirements and documentation


Desired Skills & Experience


3-5 years working experience in a similar role.
Advanced SQL (Google BigQuery), Google Analytics, experience with customer analytics, Power BI, and Excel skills.
Great communication skills, and ability to explain complex problems clearly.
Eagerness to learn new skills and share findings with the team.
Bachelor, master‚Äôs, or equivalent experience in a quantitative field (e.g. Economics, Business Analytics, Informatics, Finance or equivalent)
Capacity to thrive in a fast-paced environment, adapt quickly, work independently, and take ownership of your work.
We work with a wide array of technical systems so we‚Äôre looking for someone who enjoys learning new tools.
Fluency in English
Knowledge of an E-commerce business model.


Nice to have


Experience with Python
Snowflake and dbt
Dataform
Google Tag Manager


Our Benefits

We are a family-oriented company that takes care of its employees by offering different benefits such as:


Competitive salaries
50% discount on all BESTSELLER brands
Fit for less (tax benefit)
37 hours/week (full-time)
27 days of holidays + you can buy 5 more
Possibility to exchange the bank holidays
OpenUp for your wellbeing
Be part of our collective company insurance or a monthly allowance
Travel allowance
Flexible working times and a hybrid model
Catered lunch in the office
A culture of trust, autonomy, and continuous feedback that contributes to a positive impact.
Extensive onboarding
Plenty of opportunities and development


About BESTSELLER E-Commerce

At BESTSELLER, we are more than 15,000 people working for over 20 fashion brands such as JACK & JONES, SELECTED, VERO MODA, ONLY, PIECES, VILA, OBJECT, MAMALICIOUS, NAME IT, NOISY MAY and Y.A.S. At BESTSELLER E-Commerce, we are an international team of 170 people from more than 40 nationalities with the purpose to drive all e-commerce functions at BESTSELLER. With our office in the heart of Amsterdam as well as locations in Poland and Denmark, we are supporting all fashion brands of the BESTSELLER family and sell online in 15 countries around the world. We work in an environment where fashion meets technology. Challenging ourselves to offer the best experience to our customers and stakeholders and to work with the latest technologies is what drives us. As a team, we value autonomy and flexibility. We thrive in a flat organisation, where everyone has the chance to grow and learn. For more information, please go to www.bestseller.com.

Title: BI/data consultant
Description:
Dit zijn wij

Hey, wij zijn ForFacts. Wij geloven in een eenvoudige wereld. Een wereld met transparante besluitvorming zonder bureaucratie, waarbij mensen open staan voor elkaars idee√´n en eerlijke discussies aangaan. Het vinden van de oplossing is in onze ogen belangrijker dan het proces. Veel complexiteit wordt namelijk zelf gecre√´erd. Met onze benadering helpen wij organisaties elke dag te vereenvoudigen.




Make simplicity work







Word jij onze nieuwe Factbuilder?

Jij bent als Factbuilder een beetje rebels. Eenheidsworsten zijn er immers al genoeg. Rebelsheid vraagt lef en moed. Daarom durf jij je mening te geven op de momenten dat het er toe doet. Jouw verwondering helpt bij het zoeken naar verbeteringen, waarbij jouw creatieve geest zorgt voor passende oplossingen. Vervolgens weet jij mensen te overtuigen en mee te nemen zodat deze oplossingen worden ge√Ømplementeerd bij opdrachtgevers.







Dit breng jij mee

¬∑ Je hebt een afgeronde studie in de richting van (technische) Bedrijfskunde, Accountancy, Finance, Data Science, Operations Management of vergelijkbaar;

¬∑ Je hebt een ondernemende en positieve instelling in combinatie met een groot relativeringsvermogen;

¬∑ Je bent beschikbaar voor minimaal 32 uren per week;

¬∑ Je beheerst de Nederlandse taal goed;

¬∑ Je hebt affiniteit met data of de wens je te verdiepen in de mogelijkheden van data;

¬∑ Kennis van Data Analyse, Business Intelligence, Data Science en Lean SixSigma is een pr√©.







Dit krijg jij ervoor terug

¬∑ Met een bachelor op zak, ontvang je een minimaal startsalaris van ‚Ç¨ 2.900,- op basis van 40 uren per week. Verder bespreekbaar afhankelijk van je ervaring en achtergrond.

¬∑ Ruime mobiliteitsregeling met mogelijkheden voor een leaseauto, NS Business Card of ruime reiskostenvergoeding.

¬∑ Hybride werken: in overleg met de opdrachtgever en ons is veel bespreekbaar.

¬∑ Ruimte om je zowel persoonlijk als inhoudelijk verder te ontwikkelingen door middel van diverse trainingen op het gebied van data gedreven werken en procesoptimalisatie. Allemaal in lijn met jouw eigen ambities.

¬∑ Passie en plezier. Naast hard werken vieren wij succes met borrels, uitjes en sportiviteit. Wel leuk als je mee helpt deze gezamenlijk te organiseren.

¬∑ We zijn een startup: je staat met ons aan de basis van de ontwikkeling van de organisatie. Jouw idee√´n doen ertoe.







We zijn benieuwd of je de uitdaging aan durft te gaan. We zien jouw sollicitatie graag tegemoet!







Interesse gewekt of vragen over deze vacature? Neem dan rechtsreeks contact op met Roy Troller via +31 6 31 52 56 30 of stuur een mail naar roy@forfacts.nl.




Kijk voor meer informatie gerust even op www.forfacts.nl.

Title: Junior Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Title

Junior Business Intelligence Analyst

Job Description Summary

As a Business Intelligence Analyst for our Netherlands business, you will be a pivotal member of the Netherlands dedicated BI team, focused on local delivery and transforming Netherlands analytics offerings. Collaborating closely with local teams and leadership, you will leverage data to drive insights, enhance client value, and propel our business operations forward. Working in tandem with a locally focused data operations team, your role is nested within the larger EMEA Analytics team, ensuring synergy with a wide array of talent including data scientists and automation specialists. You will specialize in analyzing and interpreting data, providing actionable insights to inform strategic decisions for both our clients & internal operations. Your exceptional analytical skills, combined with a deep understanding of BI tools, will enable you to visualize and communicate complex data effectively. This high-visibility role is not just about analyzing numbers, it's about being at the heart of innovation and playing a key role in driving significant, positive change across our organization.

Please send your CV in English.

Job Description

Responsibilities:


Collaborate with clients and internal stakeholders to deliver market, client, and operational intelligence.
Serve as the client's advocate, translating their needs and feedback into actionable insights.
Simplify and present complex data clearly to diverse audiences, ensuring understanding across all client types and levels of leadership.
Convert strategic business inquiries into actionable insights by actively seeking out and defining necessary analytics resources and requirements.
Create prototype solutions such as reports and dashboards to visually represent complex data sets and support insight generation.
Partner closely with wider EMEA Analytics Team to ensure the maximum value and best outcome is achieved.
Deliver on the KPIs assigned to you that align with business goals, supported by a solid analytical framework.
Facilitate communication between business units and Analytics teams to clearly define project objectives, business needs, and timelines, enhancing data organization, innovation, and optimization.


Requirements:


Fluency in both English and Dutch is required.
Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Business, Economics, Real Estate or Technology.
Common MS Office applications to excellent levels including SharePoint and OneDrive.
Min. 1 years of experience in Power BI (or any other data visualization tool e.g. Tableau)
Great attention to detail, diligent and focused.
Committed, able to work to deadlines, prioritise and juggle between tasks.
Business writing and reporting skills
Thoughtful, collaborative, and proactive ready to engage with stakeholders across the globe.
Ability to build & maintain effective working relationships with internal and external personnel.
Demonstrate flexibility and ability to deliver.
Good team player, also able to work independently.
Curiosity and drive to solve problems.
Experience with SQL is preferred
Experience with Databricks and/ or Azure is preferred
Eager to learn


What Do We Offer:


An informal working atmosphere in which you work together with enthusiastic and inspiring colleagues with years of experience in commercial real estate;
Plenty of room for own initiatives, a lot of independence and responsibility plus various growth opportunities;
A pleasant workplace in a modern office in the Amsterdam Zuidas area;
Hybrid working model;
Good secondary benefits including 31 days of leave, laptop and iPhone, holiday pay, bonus scheme, pension scheme, employer's contribution to group health insurance and company fitness;
Cozy company and team outings!

Title: Data Analyst/Market Researcher
Description:
Job Description

Responsibilities:


Conduct in-depth market research to identify industry trends, competitive landscapes, and growth opportunities.
Collect, analyze, and interpret data from various sources to extract meaningful insights and inform business decisions.
Develop and maintain comprehensive databases and dashboards to track key performance indicators and metrics.
Generate reports, presentations, and visualizations to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to develop strategies and initiatives based on research findings.
Stay current on market developments, emerging technologies, and best practices in data analysis and market research.


Requirements:


Bachelor‚Äôs degree in business, economics, statistics, or a related field; advanced degree preferred.
Proven experience as a data analyst, market researcher, or similar role, with a strong track record of delivering actionable insights.
Proficiency in data analysis tools and software, such as Excel, SQL, Tableau, or Power BI.
Excellent analytical skills, with the ability to interpret complex data sets and draw meaningful conclusions.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy, with a commitment to producing high-quality work.
Effective communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey technical information to non-technical audiences.
Self-motivated and proactive, with the ability to work independently and collaboratively in a remote environment.


What We Offer:


Competitive salary and benefits package, including health insurance and retirement savings options.
Flexible work schedule and the opportunity to work remotely from anywhere in the United States.
Professional development opportunities, including training and certifications to support your career growth.
A supportive and collaborative team environment where your contributions are valued and recognized.

Title: Data Analysis Intern
Description:
Job Description

Location: Amsterdam

Start Date: September

Duration: 6 months, full-time

Are you looking to make your mark on a platform that touches the lives of millions of people? Then you‚Äôre at the right place. It's an amazing time to help our growing and dynamic team expand globally.

We‚Äôre looking for a mathematical star who is eager to make a mark and kickstart their career at a Tech Scaleup. This position will work closely under the direction of our Senior Data Analyst by supporting the high-quality use of data, locating the right information, conducting quantitative analysis and sharing findings in a relevant format. Your work will help improve the quality of decision-making across key areas of the company.

Result Areas


Contribute to the Data team‚Äôs main initiatives, picking up analysis-intensive parts of key projects, so we take Inner Circle to the forefront of data tech.
Take up the role of ‚ÄúEmbedded Analyst‚Äù in projects around the company, supporting different departments with their data needs and being a go-to ‚Äúsource of truth‚Äù.
Carry out quickfire and ad-hoc analysis as needed, getting the right numbers through to colleagues in a timely fashion so everyone is making evidence-based calls.
Continually explore the data we generate, so we spot new and exciting opportunities for projects.
Develop as a data professional, so you gain familiarity with the technologies and processes used in a scale-up business.


Requirements

What will help you be successful:


You're a student enrolled in a BSc Or MSc degree in Maths, Engineering, data or econometrics, and this internship is a requirement for your degree.
You are competent in SQL
Collaboration, helping teams across the company thrive from a data-driven foundation
Clear Communication, making complex analysis simple for every stakeholder
Learning Quickly, adopting new tools and using them effectively


What We Offer


Compensation: A monthly internship compensation of ‚Ç¨600 (based on full-time hours).
Impact: The chance to make a life-changing impact on people‚Äôs lives.
Environment: The fun and hustle of a tech scale-up within a small but profitable company.
Team: A welcoming, authentic, humble, and fun team.
Office: A vibrant office space in the center of Amsterdam.
Perks: Regular team outings and dinners, and Inner Circle membership for you and your friends.


About Inner Circle

Inner Circle is less like a dating app, more like a member‚Äôs club made for dating. Niche by design, it‚Äôs for people who live ambitious, interesting lifestyles ‚Äì and want to date people who move in similar circles. Built on the belief that opposites don‚Äôt attract, a thorough application and screening process curates a community where everyone is worth dating ‚Äì and people have more in common than just being single.

The independent bootstrapped tech company ranked in the FT1000 2020 list as one of the fastest-growing companies in Europe. The company was also the winner of Deloitte‚Äôs Technology Fast 50 in The Netherlands in 2018.

At Inner Circle, we embrace our diverse community and team. We celebrate differences and know that they are key for helping us grow. Our team consists of 40 team members, with 16 nationalities and a female: male ratio of 60 : 40. Whatever your race, religion, colour, gender, national origin, political affiliation, sexual orientation, marital status, disability or age, we make sure everyone has the space to be themselves.

Sounds like your perfect match? Apply today!

Title: Medior Data Analist

Title: Reporting Data Analyst
Description:
About Our Company

Versuni has a simple yet powerful purpose of turning houses into homes. As a house of brands Versuni is home to the brands: Philips, Saeco, Gaggia, Preethi, Philips Walita, L'OR Barista and Senseo. Through meaningful innovation, we improve the lives of people, helping them to lead healthier and happier lives every day. We are looking for a highly motivated, progressive thinker who works with a growth mindset. If you love innovation, challenges and fast-paced ideation, this role may be for you.

You Have The Opportunity To

We are seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented Reporting Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. You will be responsible for collecting, cleaning, checking, and transforming data from various sources, maintaining data pipelines for automated reporting, and ensuring the timely and consistent delivery of accurate reports. You will collaborate with stakeholders across the data organization, business, and finance sides to meet reporting needs and enhance data-driven decision-making processes.

We are seeking a dedicated and detail-oriented Reporting Data Analyst to join our dynamic team. You will be responsible for collecting, cleaning, checking, and transforming data from various sources, maintaining data pipelines for automated reporting, and ensuring the timely and consistent delivery of accurate reports. You will collaborate with stakeholders across the data organization, business, and finance sides to meet reporting needs and enhance data-driven decision-making processes.

Your Role & Responsibilities


Collect, clean, check, and transform data from various sources to ensure data integrity and accuracy.
Maintain data pipelines for automated reporting, ensuring seamless data flow and integration.
Maintain accurate monthly reporting schedules to ensure timely and consistent report generation and delivery to stakeholders.
Collaborate with a wide range of stakeholders in the data organization, business, and finance teams to understand reporting requirements and deliver insights.
Design, develop, and optimize reports to support business needs and provide actionable insights.
Monitor and troubleshoot data quality issues, implementing corrective measures to ensure high data standards.
Assist in the development and maintenance of documentation for data processes, pipelines, and reporting standards.
Perform data analysis to identify trends, patterns, and insights to support business decision-making.
Ensure compliance with data governance and security policies.
Continuously seek opportunities to improve reporting processes and tools, leveraging best practices and industry standards.


To succeed in this role, you should have the following qualifications and experience:


Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Business, Statistics, or economics related field.
2-4 years of experience in data analysis, reporting, project management or a related role.
Proficiency with data visualization tools (Power BI, Quick Sight, SAC).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with attention to detail.
Excellent communication and collaboration skills, with the ability to work effectively with stakeholders at all levels.
Highly organized, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
Knowledge of data governance and data security principles.
Ability to adapt to a fast-paced, dynamic work environment and embrace continuous learning.


Why should you join Versuni?

We are proud of the products we make. As a leading player in domestic appliances, we offer sustainable products across kitchen appliances, coffee, air, garment, and home care. The successful product ranges include the renowned Airfryer, Espresso Machine with LatteGo, the PerfectCare Elite Steam Generator, Air Purifier and SpeedPro Max vacuum cleaner. We are also known as home to such brands as Philips Walita, Saeco, Gaggia and Preethi.

In Versuni we work with contagious positivism. We believe that inclusion comes before diversity and all voices are heard. When you join our closely connected and diverse team, you'll be joining a global family. Like all families, we grow together and support each other. In our drive for digital transformation success, we partner to grow and deliver. We celebrate our wins together.

Our company is headquartered in The Netherlands, and has innovation, manufacturing, and commercial centers across the globe, with presence in over 100 countries. We employ approximately 7,000 talented individuals who bring innovation to customers and consumers.

Our goal is for you to grow every day, and to support you to become the very best version of yourself. We are committed to providing the highest levels of consumer satisfaction, underpinned by our quality approach. We make conscious choices caring for people‚Äôs homes and our planet. We grow responsibly and sustainably.

Sustainability is an important factor for Versuni. We have been 100% carbon neutral in our operations since 2020, but this is just the start of our plan. We know everything we use today will affect the planet tomorrow. For the past century, we've innovated to make products faster, better, and more energy efficient. A better future is possible with a plan that‚Äôs built to last.

Title: Data Specialist
Description:
My client within the Human Resources SaaS space in Utrecht are looking for an experienced analytics engineer/data specialist to help build out a new data team to help drive growth.




Responsibilities:

- Developing and managing data pipelines and ETL processes

- Managing data warehouses and databases

Ensuring the integrity and quality of data

- Managing and further development of dashboards and management information

- Performing in-depth data analyses and reports

- You will work approx. 2 days for the marketing team, 2 days for the product team and 1 day for the management team




Requirements:




‚Ä¢ Strong academic background. Ideally a masters in a related field (operations research, finance, econometrics, mathematics etc.)

‚Ä¢ Strong SQL skills

‚Ä¢ Knowledge of PowerBI/Tableau is ideal but not required

‚Ä¢ Experience as an analytics engineer would be a plus

‚Ä¢ Experience with stakeholder management is a plus but not required




Salary Package:




‚Ä¢ Up to ‚Ç¨80,000 per annum (D.O.E)

‚Ä¢ Travel allowance

‚Ä¢ 2 days per week in the office

‚Ä¢ Pension plan
