Title: Data Analysis
Description:
At Capgemini Engineering, the world leader in engineering services, we bring together a global team of engineers, scientists, and architects to help the world‚Äôs most innovative companies unleash their potential. From autonomous cars to life-saving robots, our digital and software technology experts think outside the box as they provide unique R&D and engineering services across all industries. Join us for a career full of opportunities. Where you can make a difference. Where no two days are the same.‚Äã




About the job you‚Äôre considering

‚Ä¢ Inputting to the T1POSx Balance Scorecard and producing relevant report.

- Updating T1POSx Balanced Scorecard

- Prepare T1POSx reports and analysis. e.g.: Tash needs for this month a report of all One Sat suppliers with their OTD.

- Facilitate T1POSx governance execution

- Monitor routine of performance with T1POSx colleagues: eg: ensure and guide people update ZEST_PO, NC declaration.




‚Ä¢ Data repository and reporting mapping.

- Map all SPOT systems and use of g-sheets. To record data for reporting use.

- Map all outputs (reports, presentations)




‚Ä¢ OES T1POS Masterplan management.

- Create tasks in the Masterplan

- Allocate ownership to the task.

- Track progress of the task.




‚Ä¢ SMP updates for Risk Management

- Create risks in SMP.

- Automate the generation of risks from SMP to ARM (in line with the agreed criteria for escalation)




‚Ä¢ Onsite assessment of key subcontractor Oerlikon

- Service provider to attend Oerlikon site in Barleben once per week until site closure varying day of attendance weekly.

- Tour shop floor and complete checklist as provided by ADS, looking at progress to plan and changes in environment.

- When NCs are raised by the supplier, the attendee shall verify the implementation of the containment and corrective action as requested by ADS.

- Prepare and deliver reports and debrief to ADS.




This role is based on site in Portsmouth - 5 days a week.




Your role

Skills and experience







‚Ä¢ In depth experience of SAP

‚Ä¢ In depth experience using an MRP/ERP tool

‚Ä¢ Excellent communication skills

‚Ä¢ Google workspace knowledge essential

‚Ä¢ Supplier management

‚Ä¢ Reporting to external and internal customers

‚Ä¢ Confident to communicate clearly to all stakeholders.

‚Ä¢ Able to work in a demanding environment.

‚Ä¢ Project management







Don‚Äôt meet every single requirements? Studies have shown women and people of colour are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single qualification. We are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive and authentic workplace so if you‚Äôre excited about this role but your past experience doesn‚Äôt align perfectly with every requirement in the job description, we encourage you to apply anyway.‚Äã




You can bring your whole self to work. At Capgemini, stiving for equity, diversity and inclusion is part of everyday life, and will be part of your working reality. We have built an inclusive and welcoming environment, for everyone.




Your security clearance

To be successfully appointed to this role, it is a requirement to obtain Security Check (SC) clearance. ‚Äã




To obtain SC clearance, the successful applicant must have resided continuously within the United Kingdom for the last 5 years, along with other criteria and requirements.‚Äã




Throughout the recruitment process, you will be asked questions about your security clearance eligibility such as, but not limited to, country of residence and nationality.‚Äã




Some posts are restricted to sole UK Nationals for security reasons; therefore, you may be asked about your citizenship in the application process.‚Äã




What does ‚ÄòGet The Future You Want ‚Äò mean for you?

You will be encouraged to have a positive work-life balance. Our hybrid-first way of working means we embed hybrid working in all that we do and make flexible working arrangements the day-to-day reality for our people. All UK employees are eligible to request flexible working arrangements. You‚Äôd be joining an accredited Great Place to work for Wellbeing in 2023. Employee wellbeing is vitally important to us as an organisation. We see a healthy and happy workforce a critical component for us to achieve our organisational ambitions. ‚Äã




To help support wellbeing we have trained ‚ÄòMental Health Champions‚Äô across each of our business areas, and we have invested in wellbeing apps such as Thrive and Peppy. You will reimagine what‚Äôs possible: creating value for the world‚Äôs leading organisations through technology to build a sustainable, more inclusive future. You will work with a range of clients all with a unique set of business, technological and societal ambitions, which will make a real impact across the UK.




Why you should consider Capgemini

Growing clients‚Äô businesses while building a more sustainable, more inclusive future is a tough ask. But when you join Capgemini, you join a thriving company and become part of a diverse collective of free-thinkers, entrepreneurs and industry experts. A powerful source of energy that drives us all to find new ways technology can help us reimagine what‚Äôs possible. It‚Äôs why, together, we seek out opportunities that will transform the world‚Äôs leading businesses. And it‚Äôs how you‚Äôll gain the experiences and connections you need to shape your future. By learning from each other every day, sharing knowledge and always pushing yourself to do better, you‚Äôll build the skills you want. And you‚Äôll use them to help our clients leverage technology to grow their business and give innovation that human touch the world needs. So, it might not always be easy, but making the world a better place rarely is.

Capgemini is a global business and technology transformation partner, helping organizations to accelerate their dual transition to a digital and sustainable world, while creating tangible impact for enterprises and society. Title: Data Analyst
Place: Newcastle Upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom
Description:
Job Title: Data Analyst

Location: Newcastle upon Tyne (2 days in office / 3 days from home)

Salary: up to ¬£40,000 (+ ¬£6,000 bonus)




NRG are seeking experienced Data Analysts to join our Client headquartered out of Newcastle upon Tyne. This is an exciting opportunity to be part of a growing organization that has recently modernised and invested heavily into its Business Intelligence platform.




Our client is a truly revolutionary, rapid growth high-tech financial services provider.




Reporting to the Data Lead, you will play a pivotal role in the team by developing organizational insights and empowering business leaders and managers with improved decision-making capabilities.




Job Duties:




Analysing behaviours, inputs, and outputs to recognize trends and deliver actionable insights for strategic planning and decision-making.
Developing and monitoring key performance indicators.
Producing accurate weekly and monthly reports.
Collaborating with senior stakeholders
Ensuring data is accurate, clean, and up-to-date.
Conducting market research and competitor analysis to support data-driven decisions




What we are looking for:




Proven experience in a analytical position producing key insights, visual and compelling reports / dashboards.
Experience with Visualisation tools such as Power BI
Capability in Business Intelligence, Modelling Data and Visualization
Stakeholder management
Excellent communication and team working skills




Desirables:




Fabric
Synapse




Benefits:




Excellent career progression opportunities
Hybrid working (2 office days per week)
Free parking




If you are interested in this role, please click ‚ÄòApply Now‚Äô and a member of the team will be in touch.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Position: Data Analyst

Location: Manchester, Scotland

Salary: 35K DOE




About the Role:

Our client is seeking a talented Data Analyst to join their dynamic team. This role offers the chance to work on diverse projects, using your analytical skills to drive strategic decisions and influence key business outcomes.




Key Responsibilities:

Analyse complex data sets to identify trends and patterns
Develop and maintain reports and dashboards to support business operations
Collaborate with stakeholders to understand their data needs and deliver actionable insights
Utilise statistical methods to solve problems and support decision-making processes




Who We're Looking For:

Experience: Minimum of 1 year in a data analyst role preferred, but not essential. Recent graduates with a First-Class degree in a relevant field (e.g., Mathematics, Statistics, Computer Science) are also encouraged to apply.
Skills: Proficiency in data analysis tools and software (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python, R). Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a keen attention to detail.
Attributes: Excellent communication skills, the ability to work independently and as part of a team, and a proactive approach to learning and development.
If you‚Äôre ready to take the next step in your career and make a real impact with your analytical skills, we‚Äôd love to hear from you!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst




Are you able to leverage data and insights to enhance the customer journey, personalize marketing campaigns, and increase customer conversion?




Do you have a strong background in understanding and utilising business intelligence systems to create various dashboards?




Do you have the ability to present complex analytical findings in a clear and concise manner to stakeholders at all levels?




MacGregor Black is currently partnering with a Leading Consumer Health, Wellness and Home Business, on the search for a Data Analyst. This is a permanent role based in London, UK.




As a Data Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in leveraging BI software to analyse complex datasets, generate actionable insights, and drive strategic decisions to enhance business performance and customer experience. Your analyses will illuminate the paths for product evolution and will be key in bringing the very best of the company‚Äôs brand to their customers.

You will play a crucial role in helping to define roadmaps for global markets, identifying opportunities for improvement, liaising with senior 3rd-party stakeholders, and forecasting products timelines.




Key Responsibilities:




Analyse large and complex datasets to identify trends, pattens and insights to improve business outcomes.
Effectively communicate discoveries and recommendations to senior leadership and key stakeholders, distilling intricate data concepts into actionable insights and business implications.
Ensure the integrity, accuracy, and security of data across various business data platforms and systems.
Stay abreast of industry dynamics, consumer trends, and competitive landscapes via diligent market research and analysis. Harness external data sources, market intelligence, and keep up to date on the latest AI advancements.
Utilize data-driven insights to enrich the customer journey, personalize marketing endeavours, and refine product functionalities to augment user satisfaction.




What are we looking for?




Proven experience (2+ years) in a deep-seated analytical and e-commerce role, with a proven track record of creating valuable insights.
Strong technical proficiency in data analytics tools and technologies (SQL, Python, Tableau, Power BI) and experience with data warehousing and business intelligence platforms.
Expertise and proficiency in machine learning, and data analytics, with a strong foundation in programming and data visualization tools.
Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and critical thinking skills, with the ability to translate data into actionable insights and strategic recommendations.
Strong business acumen and ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Exceptional communication and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex concepts to non-technical stakeholders.




Competitive salary + benefits.




Please contact Benjamin Welsh today for more information.

Title: Marketing Data Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Marketing Data Scientist




Location: London üåÜ




Remuneration: Hourly rate ¬£35.58 üí∏




Contract Details: Temporary, until 28th February 2025 ‚åõ




Working Pattern: Full Time (Hybrid Model) ‚è∞




Are you a talented Marketing Data Scientist looking for an exciting opportunity in the thriving tech industry? Our client, a leading organisation in the tech sector, is seeking a motivated and skilled individual to join their EMEA Marketing team as a Marketing Data Scientist. üìà




Responsibilities:

Manage the workload of a large project or multiple projects to maximise impact and refine timelines in collaboration with stakeholders.
Exercise sound judgement in weighing input against anticipated impact and adapt to changes as needed.
Identify issues for defined problems, navigate unexpected complexity, and propose analytical and technical solutions.
Effectively frame and escalate issues to be addressed by managers and stakeholders.
Serve as a trusted partner within the team and with cross-functional teams, providing guidance and managing relationships with partners, agencies, or TVCs.
Contribute to shared team responsibilities and the broader analyst community, such as conducting interviews or presenting analysis findings.
Utilise expertise in data extraction and manipulation, dashboarding/visualisation, statistical analysis, predictive modelling, and research techniques to drive insights and solutions.
Develop strategies to drive incremental growth by addressing complex business challenges and collaborating with stakeholders across various functions.
Conduct market research and data analysis to influence business decisions, optimise performance, and deliver best-in-class execution.
Champion an inclusive culture, creating a supportive environment, role-modelling inclusive behaviour, and driving diversity change initiatives.
Provide ad-hoc research and data analysis support to senior leaders for specific data requests.




Skills/Experience/Education:

Strong knowledge of business operations and driving efficiency and effectiveness within organisations.
Excellent consultative skills to understand stakeholder needs and provide tailored analysis and recommendations.
Proficiency in dashboarding to link, report, and analyse metrics based on available data.
Ability to convert real-world business problems into trackable metrics and generate meaningful insights from data analysis.
Familiarity with experimental design principles and best practises.
Good understanding of the tech industry landscape, including key players and technology trends.
Experience in marketing analysis and applying analytical methods to generate actionable insights.
Project management skills and ability to plan and execute projects effectively.
Knowledge of statistical analysis methods to evaluate data adequacy and draw inferences.
Strong storytelling and presentation skills to communicate data-driven insights in an engaging manner.
Technical acumen and eagerness to learn and apply statistical and mathematical concepts.




Our client offers excellent perks, including hybrid working arrangements, pension contribution matching, employee discounts, and comprehensive well-being support. üåü




If you are passionate about leveraging data to drive strategies and make an impact in the tech industry, we would love to hear from you. Join our client's innovative team in London, and be a part of shaping the future of EMEA Marketing. Apply now! ‚ú®




Please note that only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.üíº




Adecco is a disability-confident employer. It is important to us that we run an inclusive and accessible recruitment process to support candidates of all backgrounds and all abilities to apply. Adecco is committed to building a supportive environment for you to explore the next steps in your career. If you require reasonable adjustments at any stage, please let us know and we will be happy to support you.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
JOB TITLE ‚ÄìData Analyst - Marketing

Location - London




Your New Company

With over 244 offices in 33 countries across the globe, Hays are the largest specialist recruitment agency. Hays is recognised in the recruitment sector for its industry leading training & development opportunities.




Role Objectives

The Senior Data Analyst works within the UK&I Marketing Department to develop and deliver reporting and insight analysis to all business stakeholders.







Responsibilities

Creating dashboards and reports using Excel and Power BI
Support the monitoring of marketing campaign performance across the department
Maintain and deliver monthly KPI and ROI reporting for the UK&I management board and to support the marketing planning team at regional ops meetings
Creating and maintaining documentation for processes and best practices
Improve access to data sets and bring together to automate use where possible.







Skills and Competencies

Good understanding of Marketing Principles
Work autonomously, but collaboratively, demonstrating ownership in ALL activities
Demonstrates behaviour which supports the Hays brand values: Expert; Ambitious; Inquisitive; Passionate about People
Capable of interpreting data in order to make sound and timely business decisions
MS Word, Excel and PowerPoint skills essential
Excellent verbal and written communication skills
Ability to work effectively under pressure and to strict deadlines




Essential

Proven ability to design visually impactful dashboards and tell a meaningful story
Experience with complex DAX queries
Using Power Query to load, transform, and curate the data
Strong SQL skills for querying and creation of views/tables, functions, and stored procedures
Logical mindset and strong attention to details
Project management skills




Desirable:

Proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, formulas, shortcuts etc)
Experience with SFMC automations
Knowledge of Python
Experience with Microsoft Azure platform & service (eg DataFactory, Fabric)
Proficiency in PowerPoint
Experience with Google Analytics/Looker Studio




What you will get in return

As a global FTSE 250 business, Hays can offer you all the tools for a successful career. This is the ideal opportunity for someone with minimal experience looking to build a career in Bids and Contracts. You‚Äôll join the team with clear objectives set out for career progression plus all the training and support you could ask for. Hays works on a flexible hybrid basis where you‚Äôll be able to work 50% from home and 50% from our central offices. You‚Äôll also have access to all our wide range of benefits including cycle to work, private healthcare options, buy & sell leave, shopping discounts, dedicated services for mental health support & wellbeing plus a monthly wellbeing hour to use at your own discretion plus our paid volunteering day for all employees under our Working for Your Tomorrow InitiativCulture built on rewarding success and the opportunity to influence your earning potential.




Best technology in the industry and a renowned training programme to support success and drive rapid career progression and ongoing development
Flexible hybrid working patterns
Opportunity to take your career globally
Incentives and rewards to recognise performance both locally, regionally and nationally
Broad range of employee wellbeing initiatives and benefits
Referral bonus scheme
Community of internal support networks.
Paid volunteering days for all employees under our Working for Your Tomorrow Initiative.




Life at Hays presents the opportunity for growth, varied career paths, exciting challenges and a culture of inclusion that celebrates diversity. As a committed Disability Confident employer, if you‚Äôre thinking of a new tomorrow for your career, whatever your background, let‚Äôs work together to create it!




At Hays, we share a passion for creating a culture of opportunities for our people to flourish and succeed, whatever your background. We know that diversity of perspective and an inclusive approach, which encourages those experiences and views to be heard, is great for business and therefore your career.

  • Proficiency in Excel (pivot tables, formulas, shortcuts etc)
  • Experience with SFMC automations
  • Knowledge of Python
  • Experience with Microsoft Azure platform & service (eg DataFactory, Fabric)
  • Proficiency in PowerPoint
  • Experience with Google Analytics/Looker Studio


What you will get in return

As a global FTSE 250 business, Hays can offer you all the tools for a successful career. This is the ideal opportunity for someone with minimal experience looking to build a career in Bids and Contracts. You‚Äôll join the team with clear objectives set out for career progression plus all the training and support you could ask for. Hays works on a flexible hybrid basis where you‚Äôll be able to work 50% from home and 50% from our central offices. You‚Äôll also have access to all our wide range of benefits including cycle to work, private healthcare options, buy & sell leave, shopping discounts, dedicated services for mental health support & wellbeing plus a monthly wellbeing hour to use at your own discretion plus our paid volunteering day for all employees under our Working for Your Tomorrow InitiativCulture built on rewarding success and the opportunity to influence your earning potential.


  • Best technology in the industry and a renowned training programme to support success and drive rapid career progression and ongoing development
  • Flexible hybrid working patterns
  • Opportunity to take your career globally
  • Incentives and rewards to recognise performance both locally, regionally and nationally
  • Broad range of employee wellbeing initiatives and benefits
  • Referral bonus scheme
  • Community of internal support networks.
  • Paid volunteering days for all employees under our Working for Your Tomorrow Initiative.


Life at Hays presents the opportunity for growth, varied career paths, exciting challenges and a culture of inclusion that celebrates diversity. As a committed Disability Confident employer, if you‚Äôre thinking of a new tomorrow for your career, whatever your background, let‚Äôs work together to create it!


At Hays, we share a passion for creating a culture of opportunities for our people to flourish and succeed, whatever your background. We know that diversity of perspective and an inclusive approach, which encourages those experiences and views to be heard, is great for business and therefore your career.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Power BI & Azure Analyst - Bedford (Hybrid)




I am currently seeking a Power BI & Azure Analyst to join my client's growing team. Your main responsibility will be to transform data into insights that drive business value using Power BI. You will be involved in data engineering and creating data reports that will be presented to business stakeholders. As this role involves regular interaction with stakeholders, you must be knowledgeable and skilled in analysing data, delivering report solutions, and making recommendations.




Although this role prioritizes Power BI data analysis, you will also need a solid understanding of Azure SQL. You will be responsible for analysing data from multiple sources and consolidating it into data lakes. Your core responsibilities will include collecting and managing data, developing visually appealing data reports, providing insights and recommendations based on data analytics, and maintaining and updating existing reports and dashboards.







Key Skills:




Power BI: Creating data-rich dashboards
Power BI Desktop
Azure SQL
Azure Data bricks
Data Visualization & Data Analysis
SQL Queries
Python Programming for data extraction and analysis
Understanding of MS Azure
Data Modelling
Database Management







Benefits Package:




Hybrid Working Arrangement (2 Days WFH)
Competitive Base Salary
34.5 Hour Work Weeks
25 Days Annual Leave + Bank Holidays (Increasing to 28 with length of service)
Private Healthcare Scheme
Pension Scheme (6% Employer Contribution)
Christmas Shutdown
Opportunities for Development and Growth







If you're an experienced Power BI Data Analyst with Azure experience, this could be a great opportunity for you to progress your career at an incredible company with a lucrative benefits package.




If you are interested, please apply or submit your CV to elliot.twist@senitor.com.




Kind regards,

Elliot

Title: Business Data Analyst
Description:
Business Data Analyst | 100% Remote |¬£40,000-¬£55,000

KDR is excited to be partnering with a leading Commodities Data Analytics company who are on the lookout for their next Business Data Analyst.




The Company

Our client, a global software company providing innovative solutions in data management, data analysis, and business automation within the energy/commodity trading space. Due to ongoing success, they‚Äôre seeking a talented and experienced Business Data Analyst to join their dynamic Consulting team focusing on their bluechip clients within energy/commodity trade or risk management operations.




The Role

As a Business Data Analyst you will play a pivotal role in driving the successful delivery of high-quality data projects. Here's what you'll be doing:

Become an expert in our client‚Äôs data management/analytics platform, in support of clients that are active in the global energy and commodities markets (oil, gas, power, metals, agriculture etc).
Identify prospect/client requirements, design/implement data-driven workflows that leverage our client‚Äôs products and services.
Advise on / design integrations between our clients products and complimentary systems/applications e.g. Power BI, Python, ETRM systems, data lakes etc.
Support clients on data feeds - sources, structure, industry standards, publication conventions, deployments, testing
Support clients on analytics/transformations on time series / futures / options data




Ideal Candidate

Degree in quantitative/mathematics/statistics field
Ideally have familiarity with data/analytics specific to energy, finance, insurance, commodities, FX or interest rates i.e. derivative contracts (futures/options), historical settlements etc.
Strong technical skills in SQL
Foundation skills in IT/coding e.g. Python, VBA, APIs or others
Have experience engaging external stakeholders
Ability to integrate, connect, and thrive in a predominantly WFH arrangement




Why Join?

Role is 100% remote with flexible working
Working on cutting-edge project within Data and Software
Collaborative environment with world-class companies
Global presence
Opportunity to work on high-impact projects in trade and risk management




Next Steps

This Business Data Analyst role is in high demand and won't be available for long. If you're interested in joining our client's innovative team, hit the apply button now

Title: Junior Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analytics Training Programme




Want to start a career in tech?

Albany Beck are hiring for passionate individuals to join the Pioneer Technology Programme, to learn the skills to become Junior Data Analysts. This will give you the opportunity to channel your enthusiasm and be part of an Agile team who are always working with exciting technologies.




Why Choose the Albany Beck Pioneer Technology Programme?

By choosing to join our Pioneer Technology Programme, you‚Äôll be choosing to work with an organisation that‚Äôs passionate about your learning journey and committed to your ongoing professional development. The programme combines a world-class training, with the potential to gain industry standard professional qualifications. Consultants will get the opportunity to work with our interesting clients in the Financial Services, on projects that have a genuine impact from day one. We‚Äôll ensure that you get to work within a stimulating environment, where you‚Äôll have infinite opportunities to challenge yourself, grow with us and carve out the future you desire.




What to expect on the Albany Beck Pioneer Technology Programme

An 8 week training course on Data and Business Analytics, including SDLC, SQL and BI Tools
CV workshop, interview training, career coaching, soft skill mentoring and project management principles and tools.
Deployment to a mainstream firm upon completion, allowing you to work with cutting edge technologies.
An Engagement Manager will be assigned to you before your first day who will support you throughout your placement whilst keeping your progression on track, answering any questions about the project and providing upskilling support as required.
A great social environment where you are surrounded by likeminded consultants, you can expect various social events arranged by your Engagement Manager with not just your team but other Pioneers too.




What You Need

Bachelor's degree STEM subject (science, technology, engineering, math) OR, a Non-STEM degree or qualifications provided you have a passion for technology - either through doing online courses, building websites or learning technology in your spare time




What You‚Äôll Get

Fully funded training through in-person classes and one on one coaching
Competitive graduate salary, once placed, and half year pay reviews
Ongoing training and support through your designated AB Coach
Financial industry experience with one of the top global organisations
An inclusive environment, here at AB we believe in increasing representation and making sure everyone can bring their whole self to work. We don't just say the right things, we do the right thing and remove barriers to entry into Technology.

Title: SQL Data Analyst
Description:
SQL Data Analyst




Location: Coventry (on-site)




Salary: ¬£31,000







A rare opportunity to join a growing IT Team located in Coventry as a Business Systems Technician. In this new and exciting role, you will help support the development and delivery of diverse IT systems across the organisation.




Experience working with Applications, SQL and data knowledge is essential to be successful in this opportunity as you will be involved in the management of business systems.




The work that you do will have a meaningful impact on the business. You will also play a vital role in the management and administration of IT Business Systems; this includes identifying improvements, development, support, and assistance to the business.




To be successful in this role our ideal person will have:

An eye for understanding complex design (manufacturing, traceability, integration)
The drive to understand large volumes of data and system patterns.
The confidence to present your products to non-technical audiences.
The ability to adapt your communication style to account for varying levels of seniority and your audiences' requirements
Be able to define requirements, create and maintain documentation and conduct thorough testing of various systems

We will be looking for someone who:




Support design of test script, participating in full regression testing for the key business systems and other associated IT systems ‚Äì ensuring operational impacts are identified and communicated.
Will develop knowledge of the main business systems ‚Äì ERP, MES and be able to support day-today activities, including administration and basic development.
Supporting Business System division to monitor end-user system performance, report issues and maintain communications to ensure appropriate resolution.




Essential skills & experience:

Good IT skills
Ability to prioritise
Experience in supporting business applications
Knowledge of MS SQL Server would be advantageous
Ability to analyse data with attention to detail, identify associated trends and root cause of issues, implementing corrective action, as and when required.
Writing complex SQL queries
Ability to deploy hardware and software configuration
Proven analytical and problem solving ability
Strong written and verbal communication skills




Applying for the opportunity:







If you feel you have the required skills identified for this opportunity and wish to be considered, please forward an up-to-date version of your CV, and someone from Digital Waffle will contact you back within 48 hours if we feel you fit the criteria.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
London based - hybrid (ideally 3 days per week in the office)
Salary ¬£40k - ¬£45k + 10% bonus + benefits
SQL proficiency is required




Company overview




Join a formidable product team that is shaping the future of online advertising and advertising technology (Ad Tech). Our client (circa 100 staff) is well-funded and growing fast, with innovative solutions and an exciting product roadmap.




Their offering helps major advertisers (brands) and media agencies reach their current and future customers online; across desktop, mobile and TV.




Role overview




We are now seeking aData Analyst to work alongside other experienced Data Analysts and Product Managers to identify and deliver insights across our client's advertising technology and audience solutions - and run future experiments to help drive new innovations.




Responsibilities




Use your analytical skills to query, manipulate and transform datasets.
Convert analytical findings into actionable insights for the product team.
Collaborate with product management and data stakeholders to develop and maintain data models and performance metrics for new product experiments.
Support junior data analyst on SQL and other analytical tools and approaches




About you - must have




Data analytical experience (gained either at University, during internships or in post graduation employment).
A desire to learn and continuously develop your analytical skills, building on SQL and related technical language skills and tools.
Curious and problem-solving mindset.




Tech & Skills requirements - must have




Intermediate level SQL or equivalent
Computer Science, Stats or Mathematics related degree




Tools you'll have access to in the role and can be trained / up-skilled on




Looker and Looker Studio (equivalent to Power BI, Tableau
Google Cloud Platform (GCP)
DBT and transformation of data, pipelines and dependencies
Github and JIRA for sprint planning
...plus more depending on your technical area of interest




What‚Äôs on offer?




Hybrid home/office flexibility
Genuine and guided career progression to support your learning and growth
Extensive benefits including, but not limited to medical, health & wellness coaching, cycle to work, lifestyle benefits, retailer discounts, company pension, critical health cover + more
Active social calendar full of entertainment, rooftop events, sports-related and competitions

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
The Opportunity

Analytics is the compass that guides Sephora on its strategic journey, and we are on the lookout for a Data Analyst who can harness the power of data to propel our business forward. As a Data Analyst, you'll play a critical role in analyzing and interpreting customer data to drive business decisions across our digital platforms. Leveraging your strong experience in BigQuery SQL, you'll craft scripts that seamlessly integrate back-end data with Google Analytics 4 for in-depth customer analysis and segmentation.

Your expertise in data modeling will enable you to map out data structures that support the creation and maintenance of dashboards and reports, tracking key performance indicators (KPIs) related to online engagement, traffic, conversion rates, and marketing effectiveness. In this role, you'll work with data visualization tools like Power BI and Google Data Studio to develop compelling visual reports that convey complex insights in a clear and actionable manner. Additionally, you'll ensure the accuracy and quality of data, while effectively communicating your insights to non-technical stakeholders.

You Will Also Be Responsible For


Writing and optimizing BigQuery SQL scripts for GA4 analysis, integrating back-end data to segment and analyze customer data.
Developing and maintaining dashboards and regular weekly/monthly reports to track KPIs related to performance, online engagement, A/B testing, traffic, conversion rates, marketing attribution, and campaign effectiveness.
Using data visualization tools such as Power BI and Google Data Studio to create clear, actionable insights for stakeholders.
Engaging in data modeling to effectively map out data structures that support business goals.
Utilizing digital analytics tools like Google Analytics and Quantum Metric to deliver data-driven recommendations.
Ensuring the accuracy and quality of data while drawing insightful conclusions and making strategic recommendations.


What You'll Bring‚ÄØ

Your passion for detail is matched by your logical thinking and curiosity. You not only obsess over details but also possess the agility to communicate improvements rapidly and clearly. You thrive in an ever-evolving landscape, where driving innovation and continuous improvement is paramount. We are looking for a detail-oriented Data Analyst with strong analytical skills, capable of working both independently and collaboratively within a dynamic team environment.

We value ambition paired with a logical mindset‚Äîindividuals who are curious, inquisitive, and able to articulate suggestions with precision. You will utilize your strong foundation in BigQuery SQL, particularly in GA4 analysis, coupled with hands-on experience in data visualization using tools like Power BI. Your deep understanding of digital analytics, especially within Ecommerce and Retail, will enable you to provide actionable insights that drive business success. Your proficiency in digital analytics tools such as Google Analytics and Quantum Metric will be essential in providing recommendations that optimize performance.

Our Ideal Candidate Will Also Possess


Proficiency in Google Analytics, Quantum Metric, or similar digital analytics platforms.
Experience with Google Marketing Platform.
Strong communication skills, both written and verbal, for conveying complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders.
An eye for detail and a commitment to data accuracy and quality.
Familiarity with Google Tag Manager, A/B testing tools, competitor research using market share tools, setting up data feed APIs, and UX platforms would be advantageous.


While at Sephora, You‚Äôll Enjoy...


The people.‚ÄØYou will be surrounded by some of the most talented leaders and teams ‚Äì people you can be proud to work with.
The learning.‚ÄØWe invest in training and developing our teams, and you will continue evolving and building your skills through personalized career plans.
The culture.‚ÄØAs a leading beauty retailer within the LVMH family, our reach is broad, and our impact is global. It is in our DNA to innovate and, at Sephora, all 40,000 passionate team members across 35 markets and 3,000 stores, are united by a common goal - to reimagine the future of beauty.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst ‚Äì Analytics & Insights/ Performance, Investment Management




London, Hybrid




Duration: FTC 9-12 months




Our client is seeking a Data Analyst to join their Analytics & Insights team for a 9-12 month fixed-term contract. In this role, you will be pivotal in collecting, organising, and analysing performance data from a wide range of companies. Your contributions will be essential to key reporting and will support internal performance management, delivering high-quality insights that help shape strategy and portfolio management decisions.




Key Responsibilities:




Collect, structure, and input data from investee companies (including financial metrics, ESG indicators, and impact reports) into the company‚Äôs management information system.
Collaborate closely with various teams to ensure data accuracy, check for anomalies, and liaise with investees to resolve inconsistencies.
Provide Excel-based analysis on impact and performance, contributing to the company‚Äôs annual report and internal tools.
Oversee the migration of legacy impact metrics into a new data management system, ensuring data integrity throughout the process.
Support the team with ongoing improvements to data analysis and reporting processes.




Key Skills:




Data analysis: Strong experience in collecting and analysing data, ensuring accuracy and consistency across multiple sources.
Excel proficiency: Essential, with a preference for experience in automating analysis processes.
Technical know-how: Familiarity with Power BI, Microsoft PowerPoint, and accounting terminology.
Project management: Strong organisational skills to handle large datasets and meet deadlines.
Attention to detail: Critical for managing and analysing data from various reports and systems.




Personal Attributes:




Collaborative: Proven ability to work closely with cross-functional teams.
Detail-oriented: High attention to detail with a focus on data accuracy and quality assurance.
Results-driven: Motivated by achieving high-quality outcomes and continuously improving processes.

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst
Description:
Job Summary:

As an AWF Business Intelligence Analyst on the Global Ads Marketing team, you will play a pivotal role in supporting the Q4 peak season planning. You will collaborate closely with the Business Intelligence Lead to analyze data trends, develop insightful reports, and contribute to the strategic execution of our advertising campaigns. Your expertise will help optimize our ad performance and ensure a successful peak season.

Key Responsibilities:

Collaborate with Marketing Managers to align data analysis with overall Ads product strategy.
Assist with the development and implementation of operational tools for peak season planning, becoming the go-to expert.
Work with cross-functional teams to support operational excellence and drive automation initiatives.
Engage with global stakeholders to provide data-driven insights and recommendations for Ads product enhancements.
Take charge of data collection, analysis, and reporting tasks to support decision-making during Q4 peak season.
Contribute to the design and execution of A/B testing to optimize campaign performance.
Synthesize complex data into actionable reports for the marketing team and senior management.
Assist in the management and quality assurance of campaign content and audience targeting.

Qualifications:

Bachelor‚Äôs degree in Marketing, Business, Statistics, Economics, or equivalent experience.
Minimum of 1 year of experience in a data analysis role ideally within a marketing or ad-tech environment.
Proficient in data analysis tools (SQL, Excel, Tableau, etc.)
Strong analytical skills with the ability to interpret data and generate meaningful insights.
Exceptional organizational and project management abilities, capable of handling multiple tasks with precision.
Excellent communication skills, with the aptitude to present data findings clearly to both technical and non-technical audiences.
A proactive mindset, with a willingness to take initiative and drive projects forward.
Adaptable and resilient, able to thrive in a fast-paced and dynamic work environment.

What We Offer:

A creative and collaborative workplace where your contributions are recognized.
A supportive team that values innovation and data-driven decision-making.

Join us and be a part of shaping the future of advertising during our most exciting time of the year!

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you a Data Analyst looking for a business to help your grow your career and develop your skills?

You have the opportunity to join a Glasgow born organisation currently operating in 3000 cities with offices across the world as they continue to grow.

You will be joining an extremely talented team with technology at the heart of everything they do at a truly exciting time as they invest further to turn data into information and insights to aid the delivery of business intelligence solutions and reports to help grow and continually improve.

Within your daily duties you will work further with SQL Server and Power BI to analyse business data and identify customer trends/patterns while developing and maintaining advanced reporting, analytics and dashboards

Your personal development will be aided by a collaborative office environment and continued training in the form of both internal programmes and external certifications.

This is a hybrid based role with a Glasgow southside HQ with lots of great company perks and social events

If this sounds like the kind of opportunity you have been waiting for then please contact me for more details. Call me on 0141 370 9917, email me at Scott.Bentley@be-it.co.uk or message me directly on LinkedIn.... you don't need to have a CV ready, I want to hear from you!

Title: Data Insight Analyst
Description:
Data Insight Analyst

Leeds, West Yorkshire

Hybrid - 2 days in the office per week

An exciting opportunity for a highly motivated Data Insight Analyst with a passion for using data to drive business decisions to work on an exciting customer-driven data transformation programme. As a member of the data insight and analytics team, you will work closely with colleagues from commercial and operational departments to understand key business processes and design, implement, and maintain data models to optimise these processes.

You will be responsible for collaborating with stakeholders to understand data requirements and identify areas for improvement, whilst also designing and building data models that drive insights and support decision-making.

Data Insight Analyst - Key Requirements:

Strong analytical and problem-solving skills

Familiarity with data modeling

Comfortable querying, manipulating and transforming large datasets

Experience with SQL and other data manipulation or reporting tools

Good communication and stakeholder management skills

Ability to work with non-technical stakeholders and bridge the gap between technical and business needs to drive value and insight from data

Data Insight Analyst - Benefits:

Competitive basic salary

7% company bonus scheme

Enhanced contributory pension

Free parking

25 days holiday (plus bank holidays)

Excellent career progression and training

Flexible working hours & location

Additional lifestyle perks

This role offers huge opportunities for growth and professional development, as well as the chance to be part of a team driving the company's data-driven transformation, all whilst working for a highly successful people-focused business.

We are an equal opportunities employer and welcome applications from all suitably qualified persons regardless of their race, sex, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation, or age.

Title: Data Insights Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Experian is a global data and technology company, powering opportunities for people and businesses around the world. We help to redefine lending practices, uncover and prevent fraud, simplify healthcare, create marketing solutions, and gain deeper insights into the automotive market, all using our unique combination of data, analytics and software. We also assist millions of people to realise their financial goals and help them save time and money.

We operate across a range of markets, from financial services to healthcare, automotive, agribusiness, insurance, and many more industry segments.

We invest in people and new advanced technologies to unlock the power of data. As a FTSE 100 Index company listed on the London Stock Exchange (EXPN), we have a team of 22,500 people across 32 countries. Our corporate headquarters are in Dublin, Ireland. Learn more at experianplc.com

Job Description

The Data Office Insight & MI team are looking for an experienced analyst to join our Nottingham-based team. You will undertake detailed analysis on all of Experian's data assets to provide meaningful insight and performance tracking MI for internal stakeholders and for external use. You will bring a blend of inquisitive skills and data visualisation experience to ensure the showcasing of Experian data.

Responsibilities


You will work within a team focused on producing both insight and MI across both commercial and consumer bureau data
You will produce analysis and visualising this in the most appropriate way for the relevant audience
Develop and create solutions, insight, capability and products using best practice analytical techniques and following established quality procedures to help guarantee the robustness of the solution.
Use data transformation and manipulation software to extract and prepare datasets using common tooling e.g. SQL, SAS, SSIS, and present meaning results to our target audiences
Support client personnel and other departments/divisions within the business line to interpret data and resolve queries.


Qualifications


Experience interrogating large datasets which includes complex data
Experience of SQL, SAS or other relevant coding languages
An inquisitive mindset who finds chasing down hypothesis exciting
Skills in analysing data with accuracy
Affinity and skill in translating analytical outputs into compelling and creative visual stories


Additional Information

Benefits package includes:


Hybrid working
Great compensation package and discretionary bonus plan
Core benefits include pension, bupa healthcare, sharesave scheme and more
25 days annual leave with 8 bank holidays and 3 volunteering days. You can purchase additional annual leave.


Our uniqueness is that we celebrate yours. Experian's culture and people are important differentiators. We take our people agenda very seriously and focus on what matters; DEI, work/life balance, development, authenticity, engagement, collaboration, wellness, reward & recognition, volunteering... the list goes on. Experian's people first approach is award-winning; Great Place To Work‚Ñ¢ in 24 countries, FORTUNE Best Companies to work and Glassdoor Best Places to Work (globally 4.4 Stars) to name a few. Check out Experian Life on social or our Careers Site to understand why.

Experian is proud to be an Equal Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer. Innovation is an important part of Experian's DNA and practices, and our diverse workforce drives our success. Everyone can succeed at Experian and bring their whole self to work, irrespective of their gender, ethnicity, religion, colour, sexuality, physical ability or age. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know at the earliest opportunity.

Experian Careers - Creating a better tomorrow together

Find out what its like to work for Experian by clicking here

Title: Trainee Data Analyst
Description:
e-Careers is a dynamic and innovative company dedicated to leveraging data to drive business decisions.

We are looking for a motivated and detail-oriented individual to join our team.

We are seeking someone who may not have any prior experience, but has the hunger to start a career in data analysis.

We will provide any necessary training and support to help you do your job and build the foundational knowledge to launch a career as a data analyst.

Responsibilities


Collect, clean, and analyse data from various sources to support business objectives.
Create and maintain dashboards and reports to visualize data insights.
Assist in the development and implementation of data collection systems and strategies.
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to understand their data needs and provide actionable insights.
Conduct ad-hoc analysis and present findings to stakeholders.
Ensure data accuracy and integrity by performing regular data quality checks.
Stay up-to-date with industry trends and best practices in data analysis.


Requirements


No prior experience or qualifications required. We will provide all the training necessary.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Excellent attention to detail and organisational skills.
Ability to communicate complex data findings in a clear and concise manner.
Eagerness to learn and adapt in a fast-paced environment.


Benefits


Full training provided.
Competitive salary and benefits package.
Opportunities for professional development and growth.
Collaborative and supportive work environment.
Access to cutting-edge tools and technologies.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We are recruiting for a Data Analyst to be responsible for the collection and analysis of data from various sources in order to provide insights and solutions for various business problems using various tools and techniques, such as statistics, programming, databases, visualisation and machine learning.




The role will support all areas of the business to support the integration and ongoing transformation of our sales, support and operational functions.




Overview of duties:




Develop, implement, and maintain leading-edge analytics systems, taking complicated problems and building simple frameworks
Work closely with senior leadership, international data team members, and project managers to understand and maintain focus on their analytics needs, including critical metrics and KPIs, and deliver actionable insights to relevant decision-makers
Proactively analyse data to answer key questions for stakeholders, with an eye on what drives business performance, and investigate and communicate which areas need improvement in efficiency and productivity
Create and maintain rich interactive visualisations through data interpretation and analysis, with reporting components from multiple data sources
Define and implement data acquisition and integration logic, selecting an appropriate combination of methods and tools within the defined technology stack to ensure optimal scalability and performance of the solution
Develop and maintain databases by acquiring data from primary and secondary sources, and build scripts that will make our data evaluation process more flexible or scalable across datasets
Identify trends and opportunities for growth through analysis of complex datasets
Evaluate organizational methods and provide source-to-target mappings and information-model specification documents for datasets
Evaluate internal systems for efficiency, problems, and inaccuracies, and develop and maintain protocols for handling, processing, and cleaning data




Person specification:




Knowledge, skills and abilities:




Proven analytics skills, including mining, evaluation, and visualisation
Technical writing experience in relevant areas, including queries, reports, and presentations
Experience with database and model design and segmentation techniques
Proven success in a collaborative, team-oriented environment




Education / and or Experience:




Minimum of three years‚Äô experience mining data as a Data Analyst
Insurance or financial services experience preferred
Practical experience in statistical analysis through the use of statistical packages, including Excel, PowerBI, SPSS, and SAS
Strong programming experience with frameworks, including XML, JavaScript, and ETL




Key information:




Hours: Monday ‚Äì Friday, 35 Hours

Location: Bromsgrove, Hybrid




If this sounds like something you are interested in please apply, or contact Paige Hughes or Lucy Reed for further information.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Data Analyst

Location: Remote with occasional travel to head office in Wales

Reports to: Chief Technology Officer

Salary Range: ¬£40-50k




The Company:




A highly innovative AI start-up that uses advanced natural language processing and AI methodologies
Similar to the adaptive nature of ChatGPT, their Large Language Model showcases temporal dynamics honed over five years of research & development
Continuously learning and updating, their model provides real-time information and proactive strategy recommendations, setting a standard for accuracy and responsiveness
The end product is a software platform that captures, refines, and delivers highly intuitive information on demand, precisely where how and when it is needed by the user




The Opportunity:




This company is a start-up with a phenomenal track record of growth since launch. They have already secured relationships with many top tier brands in their field.




They are looking for a Business Analyst to work across all functions of their business, including sales, customer success, and engineering.




As well as providing metrics for internal consumption, the role of the Data Analyst is to provide metrics and data visualization for key enterprise level customers, demonstrating tangible improvements through the use of their product.




This is a vital role, and the Data Analyst will be expected to work with a high degree of autonomy, producing and communicating their findings to internal and external stakeholders at varying levels of knowledge, technology and data literacy.




The Role:




Extract, analyse and visualise key metrics to identify trends, patterns, and insights
Visualise data using common data visualization tools such as PowerBI, Tableau etc
Collaborate with the Customer Success Team to define requirements of our biggest enterprise clients for the analysis into the performance of our products
Perform ad-hoc data analysis and reporting to support strategic initiatives and business planning
Use statistical methods and tools to solve business problems and provide data-driven recommendations
Communicate findings and insights through effective data storytelling, visualizations, and presentations to both technical and non-technical audiences
Ensure data integrity and accuracy by performing data quality checks and validation
Stay updated with industry trends and best practices in data analysis and business intelligence




The Candidate:




Strong proficiency in data analysis tools and languages such as SQL, Excel, Python, or R
Experience with data visualization tools such as Tableau, Power BI, or similar platforms
Solid understanding of statistical analysis and data mining techniques
Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to think critically and analytically
Strong communication skills with the ability to convey complex data insights to non-technical stakeholders
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment and manage multiple projects simultaneously
Experience with business intelligence platforms and tools
Knowledge of database management and data warehousing concepts
Familiarity with machine learning concepts and tools
Understanding of project management principles and methodologies.
Experience in industries such as construction, utilities or infrastructure is a plus




The Culture:




We are a remote friendly organisation open to candidates from across the UK, but at least some time each month will be required in our Wales head office to foster relationships and collaboration.




We can offer flexible hours around family or healthcare commitments as we our primarily outcome based.




We encourage growth and learning at every opportunity with dedicated time for training and professional development, and funding and support available for training and education.

Title: Data Analyst Graduate
Place: Newcastle Upon Tyne, England, United Kingdom
Description:
A Snapshot of Your Day

As a Graduate Data Analyst, you typically be involved in a blend of data exploration, analysis, collaboration and reporting. Extracting data from various sources (databases, APIs, etc.) and being data cleaning to perform data analysis. Create visualizations (using Tableau or Power BI) to represent key business insights, and prepare reports and dashboards for partners, ensuring the data is presented clearly and effectively.

You will have an individual training plan to aid you in developing the specific skills and knowledge required for your role. At the end of the program, you will be equipped with excellent knowledge to support you for your professional career within Siemens Energy.

How You‚Äôll Make An Impact


Gain hands-on experience in an exciting and challenging services environment
Learn/improve your analytical and critical thinking skills in a variety of teams in the Siemens Energy Gas Service business.
Collaborate with a variety of key business functions to understand what it takes to keep an engineering company running.
Be a valued member within a team of Entry Level Talent (Apprentices/Interns/Graduates) to participate in the business improvement projects. The scope of these projects will provide you with valuable team working and presentation skills.
Take part in our Societal Engagement schemes, where you can push the business further and change its course, as well as represent us externally such as at STEM events.
Seek out opportunities that will strengthen your skills and enhance your knowledge to continue to support the business and your career development path.



What You Bring


Graduated with a 2:2 degree or above in data science (preferred) or STEM subject.
Are flexible, know how to connect with others and pride yourself on bringing positive, bright ideas to the team.
Feel comfortable working and reporting at all levels of a multidisciplinary team.
It would be beneficial to have some understanding of the some of the following software‚Äôs like Alteryx, Tableau or Power BI.



About The Team

Join our Data Analyst Graduate Programme and the people behind Gas Services, based in Newcastle. You will be supporting the energy transition away from traditional forms of power generation as well as providing service solutions and improvements to our customers on this journey. We have a strong Engineering team supporting a diverse product line and you will have many exciting opportunities to develop your career. You‚Äôll get to know us from the inside, develop your natural talents on the job - and become a part of the teams shaping the future of power generation.

Who is Siemens Energy?

At Siemens Energy, we are more than just an energy technology company. We meet the growing energy demand across 90+ countries while ensuring our climate is protected. With more than 94,000 dedicated employees, we not only generate electricity for over 16% of the global community, but we‚Äôre also using our technology to help protect people and the environment.

Our global team is committed to making sustainable, reliable, and affordable energy a reality by pushing the boundaries of what is possible. We uphold a 150-year legacy of innovation that encourages our search for people who will support our focus on decarbonization, new technologies, and energy transformation.

Our Commitment to Diversity

Lucky for us, we are not all the same. Through diversity we generate power. We run on inclusion and our combined creative energy is fueled by over 130 nationalities. Siemens Energy celebrates character ‚Äì no matter what ethnic background, gender, age, religion, identity, or disability. We energize society, all of society, and we do not discriminate based on our differences.

Rewards And Benefits

26 days holiday plus bank holidays

Title: Data Engineer - Python / SQL / Cloud
Description:
Summary

Location

Birmingham, Leeds, London, Manchester, Reading

Job Family

Digital & Technology

Job Type

Full Time

Posted Date

29-Aug-2024

Ref #

61306

We have a couple of brand-new opportunities for Data Engineers to join our technology and transformation team focused on building and supporting our cloud platforms. These roles will play a key role in shaping the future of our OSS systems and processes.

The team is working on migrating applications to the cloud and these are key roles to build and deploy the cloud data pipelines. You will also create new processes, efficiencies, and innovations with generative AI. We are looking for candidates technically skilled in Python, SQL and ETL development.

You will get the opportunity to join a high performing team whom this year won the Google Cloud x Formula E AI Hackathon out of 200 industry leading teams.

Key responsibilities


Collaborate with different teams to develop data pipelines.
Design, Build and maintain data processing systems by following the standard development practices.
Work closely with key stakeholders within the product teams and platform teams to understand data requirements and align cost optimization strategies with business goals.
Implement and enforce data governance policies that align with data engineering best practices and query cost optimization goals.
Tune BigQuery performance and query optimization to handle and analyse large datasets effectively.
Implement advanced Python scripting skills to automate and streamline our data processes.
Leverage deep knowledge of Data Engineering best practices to enhance data handling and storage methodologies.
Work closely with cross-functional teams, effectively communicating and collaborating to understand and fulfil their data requirements.
Engage with senior stakeholders, providing insights and aligning data strategies with business objectives.
Continuously adapt to new technologies and changes in the data landscape to keep systems at the cutting edge.
Collaborate with the infrastructure and DevOps team to facilitate data engineering requirements.



Who we are

The UK‚Äôs fastest broadband network. The nation‚Äôs best-loved mobile brand. And, one of the UK's biggest companies too.

Diverse, high performing teams - jam packed with serious talent. Together, we offer the UK more choice and better value, through our boundary-pushing, customer-championing values and ambitions.

Together, we are Virgin Media O2, and we can't wait to see what you can do.

Accessible, inclusive and equitable for all

Virgin Media O2 is an equal opportunities employer and we're working hard to remove bias and barriers for our people and candidates. So, we build equity and inclusion into everything we do, from the policies we craft to the relationships we shape. We support and encourage you to be your authentic self throughout your application journey with us.

The must haves


Strong experience in Python programming,
Experienced in SQL Scripting
Ability to develop and manage ETL processes that convert operational transactional data into dimensions and facts for easy access and analysis



The other stuff we are looking for


Experience in building batch and streaming data pipelines using BigQuery, Dataflow, Pub/Sub.
Experience in using Cloud Logging and Cloud Monitoring.
An understanding of cloud solutions such as Google Cloud Platform (GCP), or similar such as Azure or AWS
Data Build Tool (DBT)



What's in it for you

Our goal is to celebrate our people, their lives and everything in-between. We aim to create a culture that empowers everyone to bring the best versions of themselves to work each and every day. We believe the most inclusive and diverse culture makes for a better business and a brighter world.

Working at Virgin Media O2, you get a bumper reward package bursting with benefits, and loads of extras you can add if you‚Äôd like to. These are designed to support both you and your loved ones, making sure that you‚Äôre covered no matter what life throws your way.

Next steps

If we feel like a place where you can belong, we'd love to learn more about you as a person and your experience to date. Once you've submitted an application the next steps of the process, if successful, are likely to include a competency based interview.

When you apply, you'll be asked about any adjustments you might need to support the recruitment process. Let us know, and we'll be sure to discuss it with you.

Please note: Applications will be reviewed, and interviews conducted throughout the duration of this advert, therefore we may bring the closing date forward. We encourage all interested applicants to apply as soon as possible. If you‚Äôre offered a job with us, it will be conditional, based on the passing of background checks. All roles require a criminal record check and some roles need a financial probity check. Your recruiter can provide you with more information if needed.

Thanks for your patience and for showing an interest in joining the Virgin Media O2 family.

Title: Data Engineer
Description:
Reporting to one of our Lead Data & Analytics Engineers, our Data Engineer will work as part of a multi-disciplinary, agile, data delivery team focused on the delivery of innovative, robust, and efficient data solutions to complex business problems. You'll work alongside a team of passionate data professionals including other data and analytics engineers, test engineers, data scientists and data visualisation specialists.

Our priority is the delivery of high-quality, well-modelled, clean, and trustworthy data assets for use across the business. Our data teams also work hard to support all our data assets and ensure the business realise maximum benefit and return on investment from them.

As our Data Engineer, you‚Äôll have access to a wide range of benefits including:


Remote or Hybrid working
Annual pay reviews
Colleague discounts on Jet2holidays and Jet2.com flights



At Jet2.com and Jet2holidays we‚Äôre working together to deliver an amazing journey, literally! We work together to really drive forward a ‚ÄòCustomer First‚Äô ethos, creating unforgettable package holidays and flights. We couldn‚Äôt do it without our wonderful people.

What You‚Äôll Be Doing


Data Delivery: You'll be responsible for delivery of complex data solutions including the ingest of data from a wide variety of data sources into our analytics platforms (typically cloud-based but some work on our on-premise data analytics platforms), transformation and cleansing of data and modelling of data into our enterprise data warehouse for consumption by both technical users and non-technical business users via centrally developed reporting and visualisation or self-service platforms.
Data Culture: You'll drive a data-first culture both within the data team and across the business by supporting continual learning and development within your team and data enablement activity across the wider business. You'll demonstrate a passion for data and encourage a similar passion within your team. As part of a data-first culture you may also be involved in supporting production data assets (not on a first-line basis).



What You‚Äôll Have


Able to demonstrate strong written and verbal communication skills and be comfortable communicating and building relationships with stakeholders at all levels.
Experienced working in an Agile delivery environment, ideally using Scrum and\or Kanban.
Able to demonstrate strong proficiency in at least some of the following technical areas (cross-training and upskilling supported for the right individual where necessary):
SQL (mandatory): A strong understanding of SQL and be comfortable reading and writing complex SQL queries ideally across multiple platforms.
Cloud Platforms (highly desirable): Experience working with key services on either GCP (preferred), AWS or Azure. Key services include cloud storage, containerisation, event-driven services, orchestration, cloud functions and basic security/user management.
Data Warehousing (highly desirable): Experience working on a data warehouse solution irrespective of underlying technology. Experience using cloud data warehouse technology would also be beneficial - Snowflake (preferred), Google BigQuery, AWS Redshift or Azure Synapse.
Data Pipeline (highly desirable): Demonstrable experience working with data from a wide variety of data sources including different database platforms, flat files, API‚Äôs and event-driven data feeds. Experience building complex data transformations ideally using dbt. Experience working with large data volumes, near real-time or event-driven data would be an advantage. Knowledge of programming languages such as Python would be beneficial.

Additional Desirable Technical And Other Skills


CI\CD & Automation (desirable): Any experience developing or supporting data CI\CD pipelines regardless of tooling would be beneficial. We use Microsoft Azure DevOps to run most of our CI\CD pipelines. We also rely heavily on Infrastructure as Code for cloud infrastructure deployment so any experience with technology such as Terraform would be beneficial in this respect.
Data Visualisation (desirable): Although we have dedicated data visualisation specialists within the team, any knowledge of, or experience with, data visualisation platforms such as Tableau (preferred), Power BI, Looker or Quicksight would be beneficial.



Join us as we redefine travel experiences and create memories for millions of passengers. At Jet2.com and Jet2holidays, your potential has no limits. Apply today and let your career take flight!

  • CI\CD & Automation (desirable): Any experience developing or supporting data CI\CD pipelines regardless of tooling would be beneficial. We use Microsoft Azure DevOps to run most of our CI\CD pipelines. We also rely heavily on Infrastructure as Code for cloud infrastructure deployment so any experience with technology such as Terraform would be beneficial in this respect.
  • Data Visualisation (desirable): Although we have dedicated data visualisation specialists within the team, any knowledge of, or experience with, data visualisation platforms such as Tableau (preferred), Power BI, Looker or Quicksight would be beneficial.


Join us as we redefine travel experiences and create memories for millions of passengers. At Jet2.com and Jet2holidays, your potential has no limits. Apply today and let your career take flight!

Title: Data Center Engineer
Description:
Position: Data Centre Engineer (Contract)

Start Date: Immediate

Duration: 3-Month Contract (extendable)

Location: South Yorkshire and Wakefield, onsite 5 days a week

Rate: ¬£350-380 per day (Inside IR35)

Reference: 18154

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Data Center Engineer to join a Global technology company within their IT Infrastructure team.

The successful candidate will be responsible for managing the physical aspects of their data center, including the decommissioning and removal of unused equipment ('demising kit') to optimize space, power, and cooling. Additionally, this role will involve updating and maintaining documentation, such as asset management records, floor plans, and capacity planning documents.

This is a hands-on role that requires technical expertise, meticulous organisational skills, and a proactive approach to managing data center resources.

All work to be carried out in person on-site (South Yorkshire and Wakefield, UK).

Primary

DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES

Demising And Space Optimization


Identify and decommission obsolete or unused hardware (servers, network devices, etc.) to free up space, reduce power consumption, and improve cooling efficiency.
Coordinate the safe and efficient removal of decommissioned equipment, ensuring proper disposal or recycling in accordance with company policies and environmental regulations.
Assess and reorganize existing infrastructure to maximize space utilization within the data center.


Documentation And Inventory Management


Update and maintain accurate records of all data center assets, including equipment location, status, and configuration details.
Ensure that all changes to the data center environment, including equipment additions, removals, and relocations, are accurately reflected in documentation such as floor plans and asset management systems.
Assist in maintaining and improving documentation standards and processes.


Capacity Planning And Monitoring


Assist in the monitoring of power, cooling, and space utilisation to ensure optimal data center performance and to anticipate future needs.
Collaborate with the IT Infrastructure team to plan for future capacity requirements, including new deployments and upgrades.


Compliance And Best Practices


Ensure that all work within the data center adheres to company policies, industry standards, and regulatory requirements.
Implement and follow best practices for data center operations, including cable management, equipment labelling, and environmental monitoring.


Collaboration And Support


Work closely with network, server, and storage teams to support their needs within the data center, including provisioning of space and power.
Provide hands-on support for equipment installations, moves, and troubleshooting as needed.
Assist with audits and inspections to ensure the data center remains compliant with all relevant standards and regulations.


Experience Requirements

Must Haves


Minimum 5 years of experience in data center operations role, with hands-on experience in equipment decommissioning, space optimization, and infrastructure documentation.
Familiarity with data center infrastructure management (DCIM) tools and asset management software.
Experience with physical network and server hardware, including installation, cabling, and troubleshooting.
Experience creating run book documentation.


Skills And Competencies


Strong organizational skills with a meticulous attention to detail.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks and projects simultaneously.
Proficient in reading and updating technical documentation, including floor plans and network diagrams.
Knowledge of data center best practices, including power and cooling management, cable management, and environmental monitoring.
Strong communication skills, with the ability to collaborate effectively with cross-functional teams.
Project Management experience
Good understanding of lab testing best practices
Automation tools experience


Certifications


Relevant certifications such as CompTIA Data+ Certified Data Center Professional (CDCP), or similar are a plus.


Working Conditions


Physical Requirements:
Ability to lift and move heavy equipment (up to 50 lbs) as needed.
Frequent walking and standing in the data center environment.
Work Environment:
Primarily based in a data center environment with some office work.
May require occasional after-hours or weekend work to perform critical tasks or address urgent issues.

Networking People (UK) is acting as an Employment Business in relation to this vacancy.
